Abysium Dragon (Adult).name: Abysium Dragon (Adult)
Abysium Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: Drawing on radiation as both a force of destruction and a source of energy, abysium dragons are tied to the radioactive starmetal of the same name. These dragons grow deposits of pure abysium in their bodies, becoming more radioactive as they age, causing aggression, agitation, and even loneliness since not many creatures can long survive the company of an aging abysium dragon. Abysium dragons frequently turn to pursuits such as augmentation and weapon crafting (to take advantage of their innate power source) and the construction of robots (to keep them company). This work drives abysium dragons to seek out sturdy, radiation-resistant materials they can use for crafting, and they often spend years at a time scouring small moons and asteroids in search of precious materials.
Abysium Dragon (Adult).allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Radioactive Aura.name: Radioactive Aura
action->Radioactive Aura.description: 90 feet. A creature that enters the radioactive aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save against extreme radiation sickness. It's then temporarily immune to radioactive aura for 10 minutes.

action->Abysium Maelstrom.name: Abysium Maelstrom
action->Abysium Maelstrom.description: If the next action the dragon uses is Radiation Breath, the radiation becomes supercharged with arcane power. Each creature that fails its save against Radiation Breath takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,force]] damage as the supercharged radiation tears it apart from within. Each creature that critically fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it has this persistent force damage.

action->Control Radiation.name: Control Radiation
action->Control Radiation.description: Abysium dragons have ultimate control over the radioactive energy that grows within their bodies. Any time an abysium dragon deals fire or poison damage, they can choose whether that damage is magical, and they can change any amount of the fire damage to poison (or any amount of poison damage to fire).

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Radiation Breath whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

action->Radiation Breath.name: Radiation Breath
action->Radiation Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of caustic superheated gas that deals @Damage[7d6[fire],4d12[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). They can't use Radiation Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Radiation Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Radiation Breath.description: The dragon breathes a blast of caustic superheated gas that deals @Damage[10d6[fire],5d12[persistent,poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). They can't use Radiation Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Radiation Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Recharge with Radiation.name: Recharge with Radiation
action->Recharge with Radiation.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The dragon is within 60 feet of a source of incredible radiation other than any abysium dragon

Effect The dragon draws on the source of radiation, regaining all their expended spontaneous spell slots.

Aeon Guard Commander.name: Aeon Guard Commander
Aeon Guard Commander.publicNotes: Aeon Guard commanders are trained to lead from the front, using relatively short-range firearms and extraordinary skill with their dueling swords to press the advantage up close while motivating the rest of their unit to close in. Aeon Guard commanders are dispatched whenever there's a need to end a battle quickly and decisively.

weapon->Boom Pistol.name: Boom Pistol
weapon->Boom Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

A boom pistol resembles a megaphone with a trigger, emitting sudden bursts of sound capable of shattering bulletproof glass or rupturing organs.

weapon->Dueling Sword.name: Dueling Sword
weapon->Dueling Sword.description:
Upgrades: 1

Coming in a variety of styles, these traditional and time-tested weapons have been honed with advanced smithing techniques and modern materials.

weapon->Frag Grenade (Tactical).name: Frag Grenade (Tactical)
weapon->Frag Grenade (Tactical).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @Damage[1d4[bleed]]

These fragmentary grenades explode in a cloud of shrapnel and deal 2d8 piercing damage in a @Template[burst|distance:10] with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save.

armor->Aeon Guard Armor.name: Aeon Guard Armor
armor->Aeon Guard Armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

Flexible but sturdy plates layered together form this traditional armor worn by lashunta cavalry on Castrovel. In times past, a shotalashu cavalry member forged their armor from their mount's shed skin, or more rarely, the skin of a fallen mount, to honor them in future battles. Synthetic imitations are fashionable on some parts of Castrovel.

equipment->Darkvision Visor.name: Darkvision Visor
equipment->Darkvision Visor.description: This visor wraps around your visual organs, enhancing your natural senses. You gain darkvision.

action->Lead the Charge.name: Lead the Charge
action->Lead the Charge.description:
The commander Strides twice. If they end this movement within melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy. The commander's allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack the target of this Strike and ignore any cover the commander provides the target for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.UEnGE804ZFRJmQYN]{Effect: Lead the Charge}

action->Rally the Troops.name: Rally the Troops
action->Rally the Troops.description:
The commander issues an order for their allies to regroup. All Aeon Guard allies within 120 feet of the commander can use a reaction to Stride up to their Speed. Any Aeon Guards who end their movement adjacent to another Aeon Guard gain 5 temporary Hit Points that last 1 minute, or double that number of temporary Hit Points if they end their movement adjacent to the commander. The commander can't Rally the Troops again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Rally the Troops]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.p2GrXbOJbv0OT4Zr]{Effect: Rally the Troops}

action->Tactical Strike.name: Tactical Strike
action->Tactical Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The commander calls out an enemy within 60 feet then makes a Strike against that enemy, dealing an additional 1d6 precision damage on a hit. If the Strike hits, the commander changes the tide of the battle, inspiring their allies to greater feats of military prowess. All Aeon Guard allies within 60 feet of the commander gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls until the beginning of the commander's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.ppKeWbPcSaVqD1Cj]{Effect: Tactical Strike}

action->Terrifying Takedown.name: Terrifying Takedown
action->Terrifying Takedown.description:
Trigger The commander reduces an enemy to 0 Hit Points or critically hits an enemy with a Strike

Effect The commander makes a gruesome spectacle of their brutal hit. They attempt an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] all enemies within 30 feet.

Aeon Guard Trooper.name: Aeon Guard Trooper
Aeon Guard Trooper.publicNotes:
Rank-and-file Aeon Guard troopers are easily identified by their distinctive green armor consisting of ceramic and polycarbonate plates overlaid with an energy-reflective molecular coating. Aeon Guards frequently upgrade their armor with aeon stones, further distinguishing them from soldiers of "lesser" armies.

Even the newest recruits have sworn personal oaths of loyalty to the Aeon Throne—a traitor or deserter of the Azlanti Star Empire is extraordinarily rare. These troopers are also loyal to one another and highly trained to fight in coordinated formations, and they obey their commanding officers without question, even if their orders mean certain death.

weapon->Aeon Rifle.name: Aeon Rifle
weapon->Aeon Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 0

A mainstay of the Azlanti Star Empire, this sleek laser rifle includes a slot for aeon stones to enhance and focus the intensity of its beams.

weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).name: Frag Grenade (Commercial)
weapon->Frag Grenade (Commercial).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @Damage[1[bleed]]

These fragmentary grenades explode in a cloud of shrapnel and deal 1d8 piercing damage in a @Template[burst|distance:5] with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save.

weapon->Pulse Gauntlet.name: Pulse Gauntlet
weapon->Pulse Gauntlet.description:
Upgrades: 1

Popularized in underground fighting circles, this heavy-duty nanocarbon glove amplifies and weaponizes sounds made by its wielder, generating a sonic boom strong enough to knock an enemy off their feet.

armor->Aeon Guard armor.name: Aeon Guard armor
armor->Aeon Guard armor.description:
Upgrades: 1

Flexible but sturdy plates layered together form this traditional armor worn by lashunta cavalry on Castrovel. In times past, a shotalashu cavalry member forged their armor from their mount's shed skin, or more rarely, the skin of a fallen mount, to honor them in future battles. Synthetic imitations are fashionable on some parts of Castrovel.

equipment->Darkvision Visor.name: Darkvision Visor
equipment->Darkvision Visor.description: This visor wraps around your visual organs, enhancing your natural senses. You gain darkvision.

action->Coordinated Fire.name: Coordinated Fire
action->Coordinated Fire.description:
After the trooper attempts a Strike against a target (regardless of success or failure), the next attack roll one of the trooper's allies makes against the same target gains a +2 circumstance bonus. If a Strike with a bonus from coordinated fire hits, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until the end of the attacking ally's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.x9nA4lIcHmE7x8Tt]{Effect: Coordinated Fire}

action->Sharpshooter.name: Sharpshooter
action->Sharpshooter.description: When the trooper makes a ranged Strike against a target with an AC bonus from lesser or standard cover, they reduce the AC bonus by 1 for that Strike.

action->Show No Mercy.name: Show No Mercy
action->Show No Mercy.description: The trooper gains a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} targets.

Akashic Dragon (Adult).name: Akashic Dragon (Adult)
Akashic Dragon (Adult).publicNotes: Though rarely encountered outside their crumbling, relic-filled lairs, Akashic dragons occasionally live in hubs of knowledge, such as bustling space stations or cities. These dragons, bestowed with a direct connection to the Akashic Record, are arrogant curators of knowledge, assuming (often correctly) that no other being could possibly have a deeper understanding of the universe's secrets. Akashic dragons spend extensive time in the Akashic Record, often emerging after what they perceive as many days while mere hours have passed for the rest of the galaxy.
Akashic Dragon (Adult).allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. occult

spell->Interplanar Teleport (at will; se.name: Interplanar Teleport (at will; self only; to and from Akashic Record and the Universe only)

action->Akashic Eye.name: Akashic Eye
action->Akashic Eye.description: Instead of using their own memories, an Akashic dragon can ascertain information from the Akashic Records. This gives it the Akashic Record Lore skill, which it can use to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} of any kind.

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Occul.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Occult

action->Akashic Interference.name: Akashic Interference
action->Akashic Interference.description:
90 feet. The swirl of constant uploads and downloads near the Akashic dragon make attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} unpredictable. A creature other than an akashic dragon that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's Akashic interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature attempts to Recall Knowledge, it gains a +3 status bonus to its check.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature attempts to Recall Knowledge, it takes a –3 status penalty to its check.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

action->Deflecting Lasers.name: Deflecting Lasers
action->Deflecting Lasers.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The Akashic dragon raises a web of deflecting lasers using the eyes embedded all over their body, gaining resistance 15 to all damage against the triggering attack and absorbing some of the blow's energy, recharging their Akashic Barrage. If the Akashic dragon has succeeded at a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check against the creature in the last minute, they gain resistance 20 instead.

action->Akashic Adaptability.name: Akashic Adaptability
action->Akashic Adaptability.description: The Akashic dragon can activate magic and tech items with the Cast a Spell activation of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

action->Akashic Barrage.name: Akashic Barrage
action->Akashic Barrage.description: The dragon condenses cutting truths and fiery revelations from the Akashic Record into sizzling laser fire that they project as a cone from their primary eye to assail their foes. This deals @Damage[14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied] save). If a creature critically fails its Reflex save against Akashic Barrage and the Akashic dragon has succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the creature in the last minute, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round. The dragon can't use Akashic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Akashic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: The dragon recharges their Akashic Barrage whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

action->Records of the Enemy.name: Records of the Enemy
action->Records of the Enemy.description: The first time each encounter the Akashic dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if they'd succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

action->Shocking Revelation.name: Shocking Revelation
action->Shocking Revelation.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet within the last minute

Effect The dragon utters a shocking truth about the creature that even it might not know, causing it and its allies to hesitate or act erratically. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31|options:area-effect,inflicts:slowed] save. Each creature is then immune to Shocking Revelation for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

action->Akashic Interference.name: Akashic Interference
action->Akashic Interference.description:
90 feet. The swirl of constant uploads and downloads near the Akashic dragon make attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} unpredictable. A creature other than an akashic dragon that enters or begins its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to this dragon's Akashic interference for 1 minute.

Critical Success For 1 round, when the creature attempts to Recall Knowledge, it gains a +3 status bonus to its check.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For 1 round, when the creature attempts to Recall Knowledge, it takes a –3 status penalty to its check.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect lasts 1 minute.

action->Deflecting Lasers.name: Deflecting Lasers
action->Deflecting Lasers.description:
Trigger The dragon is critically hit by an attack

Effect The Akashic dragon raises a web of deflecting lasers using the eyes embedded all over their body, gaining resistance 15 to all damage against the triggering attack and absorbing some of the blow's energy, recharging their Akashic Barrage. If the Akashic dragon has succeeded at a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check against the creature in the last minute, they gain resistance 20 instead.

action->Akashic Adaptability.name: Akashic Adaptability
action->Akashic Adaptability.description: The Akashic dragon can activate magic and tech items with the Cast a Spell activation of any tradition as if the spells they contain were occult spells.

action->Akashic Barrage.name: Akashic Barrage
action->Akashic Barrage.description: The dragon condenses cutting truths and fiery revelations from the Akashic Record into sizzling laser fire that they project as a cone from their primary eye to assail their foes. This deals @Damage[14d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:stupefied] save). If a creature critically fails its Reflex save against Akashic Barrage and the Akashic dragon has succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about the creature in the last minute, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round. The dragon can't use Akashic Barrage again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Akashic Barrage]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Records of the Enemy.name: Records of the Enemy
action->Records of the Enemy.description: The first time each encounter the Akashic dragon hits and deals damage to a creature with their jaws Strike, they receive information about the creature as if they'd succeeded at a check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about that creature.

action->Shocking Revelation.name: Shocking Revelation
action->Shocking Revelation.description:
Requirements The dragon has successfully Recalled Knowledge about an enemy within 90 feet within the last minute

Effect The dragon utters a shocking truth about the creature that even it might not know, causing it and its allies to hesitate or act erratically. Every enemy within 90 feet that can hear the secret must attempt a @Check[will|dc:31|options:area-effect,inflicts:slowed,inflicts:confused] save. Each creature is then immune to Shocking Revelation for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Akata.name: Akata
Akata.publicNotes:
Few creatures inspire more dread in isolated explorers and lonely space stations than the breathless, leonine akatas, which infest creatures with parasites to transform them into ravenous void zombies.

An akata's toothy maw, glowing yellow eyes, and lashing twin tails mark it as a silent predator. Their slinking, hairless blue flesh spreads out into a mane of rubbery tentacles. Despite lacking ears, these quadrupeds stalk prey with an enhanced sight and sense of smell. Akatas typically stand at about 3-1/2 feet tall and weigh 400 pounds.

In times of scarcity, akatas ooze noqual from their pores and spin pale green crystalline cocoons capable of holding them in stasis for centuries. They can even use their cocoons to traverse space and find new hosts for their larvae. When a host dies from this infestation, known as void death, the strongest offspring animates the cadaver as a void zombie. Fiercely territorial, they hunt in colonies that are capable of bringing a settlement to its knees within weeks.

action->Hibernation.name: Hibernation
action->Hibernation.description: An akata can secrete resin that encases it safely in a noqual cocoon. The cocoon has Hardness 9, 40 HP, and a BT of 18. It has resistance 5 to damage from magical sources. While ensconced within this cocoon, the akata can't be harmed, doesn't need to eat or drink, and gains @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} 30 feet. During its hibernation, the akata remains dormant until exposed to extreme heat or it senses a living creature. It can then break free of its cocoon within [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

action->No Hearing.name: No Hearing
action->No Hearing.description: Akatas are immune to auditory effects, automatically critically fail Perception checks that require it to hear, and take a –2 status penalty to Perception checks (but not initiative rolls) that involve sound but also rely on its other senses.

action->Salt Water Vulnerability.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
action->Salt Water Vulnerability.description: Salt water attacks an akata's cells and acts as a potent acid. If the akata is fully immersed in salt water, it takes @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage from the water immediately and at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains immersed. Its weakness to salt water applies to this damage.

action->Void Death.name: Void Death
action->Void Death.description:
An akata implants microscopic larvae into any creature it bites, but only Small or Medium humanoids make suitable hosts; all other creatures are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} at Stage 2 and further instead.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead and corpse rises as a void zombie in [[/gmr 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

Alloid (Ship Stealer).name: Alloid (Ship Stealer)
Alloid (Ship Stealer).publicNotes:
Alloids are interplanetary scavengers sent by the Dominion of the Black to plague the galaxy. These tall, thin, and spindly creatures appear to have metallic sheens to their smooth skin, often in copper or gold tones. An alloid's surprisingly pliable physiology allows them to mold their physical form to fit into tight spaces or stretch paper-thin against surfaces. It's rumored they can, with great effort, even mimic other people.

While few enough people have encountered alloids for the name to truly catch on, they've become colloquially known as "ship stealers" in the Pact Worlds. They frequently travel in groups of three to five, hanging around spaceports and scoping out potential marks. They often look for smaller ships with crews not much larger than their pack or massive ships with many hiding places. They then slip aboard inside containers or backpacks, often during resupply cycles.

Once the ship is out in space and the crew settled in, the pack gets to work, ideally taking out their targets one by one with barbs that make their prey's flesh as malleable as their own, allowing them to easily hide the bodies. After kidnapping a crew, they fly the ship to places where they can link up with other alloids—or their Dominion masters—to strip the starship for parts. What they do with their living prey is unknown.

Before the Gap, the Dominion of the Black had a strong presence on Aucturn and would occasionally invade other planets, such as Lost Golarion, in search of brains to devour and in pursuit of other mysterious agendas. Now, the people of the Pact Worlds understand that the Dominion has secret bases across the galaxy—the Pact Worlds might draw their attention from time to time, but their missions take them to many worlds and many star systems.

The Dominion creatures most commonly seen by others are mere scouts, while more powerful members of the Dominion conglomeration emerge only rarely to terrorize society. Stories of these creatures are as few as the scant number of people who survive such encounters—most spacefarers know to immediately flee any ship or territory with signs of Dominion presence.

weapon->Knife.name: Knife
weapon->Knife.description:
Upgrades: 1

Invaluable as both a weapon and a tool, knives come in a variety of shapes, styles, and materials ranging from starmetals to ceramics.

action->Malleable Flesh.name: Malleable Flesh
action->Malleable Flesh.description:
Trigger The alloid is hit or critically hit by a Strike or spell attack, and they aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}

Effect The alloid gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Flesh Putty.name: Flesh Putty
action->Flesh Putty.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Maximum Duration 12 hours

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 round)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (2d6 hours), and the target's body becomes permanently malleable as per Putty Form until they've completely recovered from flesh putty

action->Putty Form.name: Putty Form
action->Putty Form.description: The alloid's body melts and molds to fit into tight spaces or stretches paper-thin against a flat surface. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Stealth checks to [[/act hide options=putty-form]] and to their Stealth DC when using this ability while adjacent to walls or within tight spaces (at the GM's discretion). Alloids using this ability can squeeze into spaces, including into closed containers or through doors, as though they were Tiny. The alloid can use Putty Form again to return to their standard, more solid form.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The alloid deals an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Animated Firearm.name: Animated Firearm
Animated Firearm.publicNotes:
Animated firearms make for great training aids but can just as easily defend goods and possessions from intruders or serve as hidden sentries.

Objects can be animated in multiple ways for a variety of functions. Since ancient times, weapons and armor have been given life as guardians and sentries through magic or ritual.

action->Unreliable Tech.name: Unreliable Tech
action->Unreliable Tech.description: Once an animated firearm is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, it becomes permanently @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} until its Hit Points are fully restored (such as by being Repaired).

action->Weapon Mode.name: Weapon Mode
action->Weapon Mode.description: In the hands of its creator, an animated firearm is a commercial laser pistol. The creator can Interact to release the firearm into an adjacent space to act on its own, or to retrieve it from an adjacent space and use it as a weapon.

action->Stun.name: Stun
action->Stun.description:
A creature that takes damage from the animated firearm's stun gun must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).

On a critical hit, the target creature uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its roll. On a success, the target is immune to stun for 1 minute.

Animated Tech Armor.name: Animated Tech Armor
Animated Tech Armor.publicNotes:
Animated suits of tech armor excel as loyal bodyguards, training dummies, or security.

Objects can be animated in multiple ways for a variety of functions. Since ancient times, weapons and armor have been given life as guardians and sentries through magic or ritual.

action->Unreliable Tech.name: Unreliable Tech
action->Unreliable Tech.description: Once an animated firearm is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, it becomes permanently @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} until its Hit Points are fully restored (such as by being Repaired).

action->Jetpack Tackle.name: Jetpack Tackle
action->Jetpack Tackle.description: Using a built-in thruster pack, the animated armor Strides and then attempts a [[/act shove]], moving with the target on a success or critical success. After resolving the Shove, the animated tech armor attempts to [[/act trip]] the target using the same multiple attack penalty as the Shove. The animated armor then falls @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Apari.name: Apari
Apari.publicNotes:
An apari is a living hive beholden to its beetle-like queen, whose massive carapace houses generations of its insect brood. Millions of constituents across various developmental stages animate the exoskeleton of a single apari. At the direction of their queen's chemical signals, individual constituents, most no larger than a grain of rice, adapt to the hive's current needs, assuming diverse forms to fulfill specialized roles and supporting its gestalt biological functions.

Once introduced within an ecosystem, an apari asserts itself rapidly. Winged constituents forage for food as the hive itself hunts living prey, tearing its victims open with sharp claws while grub-like constituents writhe into fresh wounds and consume the prey from within. When an apari is threatened, combat-ready drones selflessly rush to defend the hive or to cover its escape.

action->Carapace.name: Carapace
action->Carapace.description: The apari's carapace has Hardness 10, reducing any damage the apari takes by that amount. Once the apari is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon taking damage from a critical hit, the carapace breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its AC to 20. An apari with a broken carapace gains resistance 5 to precision damage and weakness 5 to both area damage and splash damage. It also gains the Swarming Bites aura.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description:
10 feet. The constituents of an apari with a broken carapace angrily swarm around its body. A creature that begins its turn in this aura takes @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save. A creature that fails this save is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

Can alternatively switch to @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] or @Damage[4d6[slashing]] with the Fungible ability.

action->Constituent Sortie.name: Constituent Sortie
action->Constituent Sortie.description:
Requirements The apari's carapace isn't broken

Effect The apari releases a bevy of tiny, flying constituents in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that sting all within. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[4d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save.

action->Foraging Constituents.name: Foraging Constituents
action->Foraging Constituents.description: The apari Seeks by dispersing constituents to scan a wide area, attempting to find hidden or undetected creatures within 90 feet.

action->Fungible.name: Fungible
action->Fungible.description: The apari's constituents can change their physiology, taking advantage of an opponent's weakness. The apari alters the type of damage it deals with its claw attack (which also affects the type of persistent damage), its Constituent Sortie ability, or its swarming bites aura, choosing from the following: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

Appendage Cluster.name: Appendage Cluster
Appendage Cluster.publicNotes: Caypins are brawny predators with the agility of wolves and the scaly skin of crocodiles. Their most striking feature is a mass of wriggling, semi-sentient appendages that cover their heads. Each of these tentacle-like protuberances contains a bloodshot eyeball and a gaping mouth full of teeth, and the caypin—which has no eyes or mouth of its own—relies on these orifices to see and feed. Nutrients absorbed by the appendages are passed to the caypin via tiny receptive sockets in the beast's jaw, and caypins can detach these appendages into writhing clusters that independently move up to 100 feet from their bodies. In the wild, caypins use these clusters to ambush prey, and the creatures are known across the galaxy for their rapacious ability to consume half of their body weight in raw meat.

action->Cluster Onslaught.name: Cluster Onslaught
action->Cluster Onslaught.description: An appendage cluster attempts an Acrobatics check to [[/act tumble-through]] a creature's space. On a success, the mouths of the cluster gnash and gnaw at the creature, dealing @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage. If the Acrobatics check was a critical success, the target also takes @Damage[4[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Arabuk.name: Arabuk
Arabuk.publicNotes:
Arabuks take 3 years to reach maturity. Each year that an arabuk lives, its antlers grow more impressive, sometimes reaching lengths greater than 15 feet.

Those traveling through Akiton's Winterlands risk stumbling on its apex predator: the carnivorous arabuk.

action->Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
action->Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair an arabuk's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.

action->Avalanche.name: Avalanche
action->Avalanche.description: A non-arabuk creature standing on snow that fails its Reflex save against an arabuk's antler reverberation is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. Up to a @Template[cube|distance:20] of snow in the area of an antler reverberation collapses, dealing @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage to adjacent creatures (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save). On a slope, this causes the snow and any creatures that fail its save to move downhill 30 feet per round. At the start of its turn, each creature caught in the avalanche takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save) and, on a failure, is still caught in the avalanche.

action->Clatter.name: Clatter
action->Clatter.description: The arabuk clatters its antlers together by shaking its head. Until the end of its turn, any creature hit by its antlers must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|options:inflicts:stunned] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} on a critical failure).

action->Glacial Stride.name: Glacial Stride
action->Glacial Stride.description: The arabuk Strides twice with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring difficult terrain caused by ice, snow, or other arctic conditions.

Arqsheth.name: Arqsheth
Arqsheth.publicNotes:
Believed to have once taken the shape of ballista-sized arbalests, arqsheths are living cannons who line the walls of Heaven to defend it against fiends. They often make themselves known to pure-hearted mortals who are either in the path of an imminent fiendish incursion or else struggling to vanquish a vile foe. They can be obsessively goal oriented and have been known to abandon a stalwart ally to pursue a fiend rather than delay the fight against their target.

Once an arqsheth destroys the object of their pursuit or determines that their wielder no longer needs their aid, they typically return to Heaven, but rare circumstances sometimes lead an arqsheth to remain in the Universe for an extended time. These arqsheths might find themselves embarking on long journeys with a loyal starship crew, standing guard over a seemingly abandoned planet, or taking up a post near a Drift beacon. They never reveal their motivation for remaining, and some suspect that arqsheths have a sort of sixth sense that warns of potential threats and leads them to take up such posts.
Arqsheth.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Archon's Protection.name: Archon's Protection
action->Archon's Protection.description:
Trigger An enemy damages the archon's ally and both are within 15 feet of the archon

Effect The ally gains resistance 15 to all damage against the triggering damage, and the archon can make a Strike against the enemy. This Strike doesn't count toward the archon's multiple attack penalty, and their multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.IsNnfuzanT5teGt4]{Effect: Archon's Protection}

action->Armament of the Archons.name: Armament of the Archons
action->Armament of the Archons.description:
A single creature can wield an adjacent willing arqsheth as a free action as long as it has two free hands. Once wielded by another creature, an arqsheth can't be wielded by a different creature until the start of the arqsheth's next turn. While wielded as a weapon, an arqsheth counts as a martial ranged weapon that deals @Damage[2d10[fire]] damage; is in the laser group; has a range increment of 40 feet; and has the analog, holy, and tracking +2 traits. Strikes made with this weapon deal an extra @Damage[1d10[spirit]] damage. They don't require ammunition and have no Bulk, as they support their own weight.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c3Y1xZ6IIxbsnPk1]{Effect: Armament of the Archons}

action->Archon's Pursuit.name: Archon's Pursuit
action->Archon's Pursuit.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The arqsheth saw another creature teleport within the last round

Effect The arqsheth casts @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, which is heightened to 5th rank and causes the arqsheth to arrive in an unoccupied space they choose within 30 feet of the creature they're pursuing. If the creature is too far away, the arqsheth arrives as close as possible.

action->Righteous Cannon.name: Righteous Cannon
action->Righteous Cannon.description: An arqsheth can be the target of spells that can target a ranged weapon, such as @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.SbBqa1HStMrV47fb]{Supercharge Weapon}, while wielded by another creature.

Assembly Ooze.name: Assembly Ooze
Assembly Ooze.publicNotes:
The assembly ooze is believed to have been created by accident when a manufacturing company attempted to automate an object printer as a cost cutting measure. The original creature has long since left containment in the Pact Worlds, replicating itself across the cosmos. While often considered a nuisance akin to pests of yore, an assembly ooze left unchecked on a starship or space station can eventually turn into an existential threat.

An assembly ooze typically takes the form of an amorphous metallic cube. It has an outer shell composed of a liquid polycarbonate slurry that encases a core of replicating nanobots. The ooze's color can change based on the materials it breaks down, but it's most often a metallic amalgamation of brown or gray. To survive, the ooze attempts to constantly disassemble technological items in following its programmed subroutines then manufacture something new. The nanites within an assembly ooze do have a drive for reproduction, splitting in a process similar to cellular mitosis when the ooze absorbs enough material in a short period of time. Assembly oozes generally don't assault those not carrying the technological items they require as fuel but do lash out to protect themselves.

Oozes of many types lurk in dark and abandoned places across the galaxy, emerging only to satiate their appetites and threaten adventurers, explorers, and hapless workers alike.

action->Techsense.name: Techsense
action->Techsense.description: An assembly ooze can detect creatures and objects with the tech trait as a precise sense within the listed range.

action->Assemble.name: Assemble
action->Assemble.description: Over the course of 1 minute, the assembly ooze crafts a random piece of gear (rolling a [[/r 1d6]]: 1–armor, 2–shield, 3–weapon, 4–armor upgrade, 5–weapon upgrade, or 6–tech item) using the UPBs stored inside of it. An assembly ooze can craft items with a cost up to the UPBs stored, but with an item level and Bulk of no greater than 4 each.

action->Disassemble.name: Disassemble
action->Disassemble.description: The assembly ooze engulfs an adjacent, unattended piece of gear of no more than 4 Bulk, deconstructing it into its component parts. The ooze gains a number of UPBs equal to the item's price in credits. An assembly ooze can hold up to 1,000 UPBs at a time.

action->Sticky Disarm.name: Sticky Disarm
action->Sticky Disarm.description:
Requirements The assembly ooze's last action was a successful pseudopod Strike

Effect The ooze attempts to [[/act disarm options=sticky-disarm]] the creature it hit. It gains a +4 status bonus to the Athletics check. This attempt neither applies nor counts toward the ooze's multiple attack penalty.

Asteray.name: Asteray
Asteray.publicNotes:
Thought to be merely mischievous tricksters, asterays are in fact fey born where the Void and First World overlap. Gifted with the innate ability to survive in space, asterays suffer from extreme wanderlust and an overwhelming desire to stave off boredom, with a desperate thirst for amusement being the prime motivation of most of their kind. They find themselves attracted to interesting stellar phenomena, from the swirls in gas giants to the interplay of stellar debris in an asteroid field. By floating through space, asterays gather enough sustenance to survive from their innate ability to consume latent cosmic radiation. However, asterays have one simple nutritional need that makes them a terror of the space lanes: organic matter. As space is all but devoid of organic elements for consumption, asterays resort to trailing starships, often by riding in their wake and tormenting the crew until they either abandon their posts or descend into chaos. Once an asteray has sufficiently driven a crew to despair, they enter the vessel and consume the corpses of the fallen.

Luckily—or perhaps not—for travelers, asterays typically find the consumption of living creatures distasteful, though their alien mindsets open them to using their vacuous ability to consume matter on active foes when threatened. Most asterays hibernate for months or even years at a time, floating in the wrecks of abandoned ships until the cosmic eddies of a passing ship stirs them from their torpor.

action->Wake Rider.name: Wake Rider
action->Wake Rider.description: By touching a starship, an asteray can bond to the energy wake it leaves as it travels. The asteray can match speeds with the starship and ride along with it, treating the ship as if it were the "ground" so long as they remain within 100 feet. If the starship enters the Drift, the asteray can choose to accompany it into the Drift, or they can disengage as a reaction and remain behind.

action->Matter Consumption.name: Matter Consumption
action->Matter Consumption.description: The asteray opens their mouth to suck in the molecules of an adjacent organic creature or object of Small size or larger. If the target is an object (including a corpse), then the asteray regains @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 for the next minute, and they can use the extra action only to Climb, Fly, or Stride. If the target is a creature, then the target takes @Damage[10d8[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save).

action->Sensor Song.name: Sensor Song
action->Sensor Song.description: An asteray can "sing" electronic signals that mask or mimic sensor readings. The asteray creates a false image of an object, as a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.2oH5IufzdESuYxat]{Illusory Object} spell. This false reading affects only electronic sensors, but creatures hear odd echoes in the area so long as the effect persists. Multiple asterays can sing together, doubling the range and area of illusory object for each asteray casting the spell in sync.

Athraxer.name: Athraxer
Athraxer.publicNotes:
Swarm invasions deploy athraxers as infantry. Fearless and violent, they're crucial for providing reconnaissance of a world's environment and defenses. A single Swarm ship can carry thousands of eggs in stasis.

Developing far out in the Vast from an insectile species known as kucharns, the Swarm is considered the greatest threat in existence for several cultures. Composed of countless subcolonies, each consisting of myriad component subspecies, the Swarm is a vast host that acts in psychic union for the purpose of consuming all matter across the cosmos. Most frightening of all is the Swarm's ability to assimilate the knowledge and DNA of those they consume. Thanks to its pre-Gap development of star travel, the Swarm had already consumed innumerable systems before history short-circuited, and the Swarm's pace only accelerated once it received access to the Signal and the hyperspace dimension known as the Drift.

Worlds touched by the Swarm are drained of their natural resources and rendered barren places known as huskworlds. What outsiders consider to be "Swarm space" is little more than a swathe of lifeless worlds that the Swarm have consumed in its reckless advance. The Swarm so thoroughly strips these worlds that surveyors struggle to find even trace amounts of inorganic resources, such as rare minerals and water. Few of these huskworlds have been thoroughly explored, as oftentimes exploration awakens inert drones, theorized to have been left behind in case the devoured system was ever colonized and repopulated. Pockets of Swarm activity exist well beyond this region of space, as the Swarm sent out countless subcolonies in the ages before the Gap, and even now, only some of them have reached their intended destinations.

The Swarm is perhaps most known in the current era for two important facts. First, its assault on the Pact Worlds and the Veskarium led to the cessation of hostilities and tenuous alliance between the two powers. Second, the Swarm is the direct ancestor of the shirren species. Having broken away sometime during the Gap, shirrens found succor with the deity Hylax, who was believed to have evolved from a pre-Swarm kucharn and who turned her back on the ravenous entity the Swarm has evolved into.

In recent years, the Swarm had been seen as little more than a distant boogeyman with no activities save for classified actions in the Suskillon system in the Vast. However, the recent discovery of the missing Szandite world of Krethiskar inadvertently awoke a dormant subcolony that had been responsible for the world's consumption. Since then, the newly dubbed Krethiskar subcolony has become a scourge of Near Space, engaged in an active invasion of Szandite Collective worlds and poised to spill over into other powers like the Veskarium and Pact Worlds. This rediscovered subcolony has begun rapid evolution of its components and remains cut off from the wider Swarm, but it still represents a clear danger to Near Space.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: An athraxer can sense nearby creatures through vibrations in air or water caused by movement as an imprecise sense at the listed range.

action->Acid Blood.name: Acid Blood
action->Acid Blood.description: An adjacent creature that deals slashing or piercing damage to the athraxer is sprayed with acidic blood and takes 2 persistent acid damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save).

action->Colony Mind.name: Colony Mind
action->Colony Mind.description: 30 feet. All allies with colony mind within the listed range of each other are in constant telepathic communication and are aware of all threats any individual knows about. While within range of at least one ally with colony mind, when a creature rolls a success on a save against a mental effect, it gets a critical success instead.

action->Death Throe.name: Death Throe
action->Death Throe.description:
Trigger The athraxer would die

Effect The athraxer first makes a claw Strike against a creature in reach, then dies.

Atlapak.name: Atlapak
Atlapak.publicNotes:
Atlapaks are aquatic ambush predators renowned for their ability to create a sonic pulse that can stun or kill targets from hundreds of feet away. These enormous arthropods have banded shells, three compound eyes on movable stalks, a dexterous right claw for grasping and tearing, and an oversized, highly specialized left claw that generates a cavitation bubble when it snaps shut, which then implodes with crushing force. The atlapak uses plates on its carapace to direct the resulting sonic burst toward prey with uncanny accuracy.

Despite their animalistic intelligence, atlapaks have an instinctive understanding of ballistics and fluid dynamics. Their antennae detect subtle changes in currents and fluid density, allowing them to detect moving targets from a great distance and calibrate their cavitation blasts accordingly. Their compound eyes detect multiple wavelengths of light and provide incredible depth perception comparable to advanced sniper scopes.

Atlapaks prefer sheltered burrows that provide commanding views, such as coral reefs or low hills where they can conceal themselves and pick off prey at a distance. Though they typically stay in the silt of their underwater lairs, atlapaks can range far to mate. Historically, a spawning atlapak sticks fertilized eggs onto migrating megafauna that carry their offspring to new environs with unclaimed territory and resources. In the modern era, this behavior has led to eggs being stuck to the hulls of ships, where they can survive even in humid terrestrial environments. Juvenile atlapaks sometimes haunt a jungle or coast before returning to the safety of the ocean.

Atlapaks can grow up to 10 feet long, while juveniles are typically at least 5 feet long. Their predatory instincts kick in almost immediately after birth.

action->Aerial Buoyancy.name: Aerial Buoyancy
action->Aerial Buoyancy.description: The atlapak can "swim" through the air in a thick atmosphere by inflating its lightweight body. Its fly Speed is reduced by half in a normal atmosphere, and it loses its fly Speed entirely while in an environment with a thin atmosphere or no atmosphere.

action->Cavitation Blast.name: Cavitation Blast
action->Cavitation Blast.description:
The atlapak makes a sonic snap Strike with a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. The range increment for this Strike increases to 125 feet, and the Strike ignores up to 5 Hardness, or 250 feet and 10 Hardness in a thick atmosphere.

On a critical hit, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] or @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save in a thick atmosphere.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

action->Dense Atmosphere Dependent.name: Dense Atmosphere Dependent
action->Dense Atmosphere Dependent.description: An atlapak's sonic snap is most effective in thick atmosphere or underwater. In normal or thin atmosphere, the range increments of its Cavitation Blast and sonic snap Strike are reduced by half, its Cavitation Blast ignores only up to 5 Hardness, and the DC for its Cavitation Blast decreases by 2. An atlapak's sonic snap Strike can't function in environments with no atmosphere.

Barachius Angel.name: Barachius Angel
Barachius Angel.publicNotes:
Barachius angels are imposing, helmed figures with glowing wings made of digital circuitry. They monitor the development of technology to prevent it from being used for malevolent purposes. Toward this divine end, their armaments have been blessed with holy energy. They can produce a retractable data blade that extends from their hand and that can be used to interface universally with computer terminals and data ports on robots.

Barachius angels serve as divine vanquishers to benevolent gods—purging technology across the Universe deemed to be twisted or evil. Their philosophies on what constitutes evil can be unclear, as these angels might hunt down an individual malfunctioning robot yet leave nuclear missile silos untouched.

While many angels in modern times ascended from mortal souls across the cosmos, these celestial beings were among the first creatures to exist in all the cosmos. Warriors and messengers of the gods, they're utterly devoted to their cause, whether that be destroying evil or spreading a deity's message across the galaxy.

weapon->Dueling Sword.name: Dueling Sword
weapon->Dueling Sword.description:
Upgrades: 1

Coming in a variety of styles, these traditional and time-tested weapons have been honed with advanced smithing techniques and modern materials.

weapon->Laser Rifle.name: Laser Rifle
weapon->Laser Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

These dependable, mass-produced rifles shoot concentrated beams of energy out of square-shaped barrels. The universal standard Pact Worlds model is highly modifiable and designed to function with a variety of accessories and upgrades, with wielders adapting the laser rifle to their preferences and even kit-bashing it into a nearly unrecognizable weapon.

action->Divine Farewell.name: Divine Farewell
action->Divine Farewell.description: 20 feet. All creatures within the angel's aura gain a +1 status bonus to their AC and saving throws against attacks and effects from creatures and hazards with the unholy trait.

action->Angelic Override.name: Angelic Override
action->Angelic Override.description:
The barachius makes a digital dagger Strike against an adjacent creature or item that has the tech trait.

On a hit, the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|options:inflicts:controlled,inflicts:dazzled,inflicts:stunned] saving throw as the angel's holy influence attempts to seize control over it. A target with the holy trait use the outcome one degree of success better than the result of its roll, while one with the unholy trait uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its roll.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's vision is filled with holy sigils and code, giving it the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition until the end of its next turn.

Failure As success, and the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The target's core processes are seized by the angel, giving the target the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled} condition for 1 minute. While the target is controlled by the barachius, the angel can also use any of their spells as if it originated from the target rather than the angel. The target can attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the controlled condition.

action->Holy Arms.name: Holy Arms
action->Holy Arms.description: In the hands of a barachius angel, all weapons gain the holy and magical traits and are powered by divine will, negating the need for batteries or ammunition.

Bastorox.name: Bastorox
Bastorox.publicNotes:
The dreaded bastoroxes are bio-organic bulwarks that use an immense chitinous shield to deflect damage while loosing bolts of bioelectricity at foes. They hold positions for advancing Krethiskar subcolony components, such as the multitudes of agile emganats. These biohulks are but one of the new innovations found within the ranks of the Krethiskar subcolony, and they were active during the siege of Rodnarth, where they implacably advanced through that world's treacherous swamps.

Developing far out in the Vast from an insectile species known as kucharns, the Swarm is considered the greatest threat in existence for several cultures. Composed of countless subcolonies, each consisting of myriad component subspecies, the Swarm is a vast host that acts in psychic union for the purpose of consuming all matter across the cosmos. Most frightening of all is the Swarm's ability to assimilate the knowledge and DNA of those they consume. Thanks to its pre-Gap development of star travel, the Swarm had already consumed innumerable systems before history short-circuited, and the Swarm's pace only accelerated once it received access to the Signal and the hyperspace dimension known as the Drift.

Worlds touched by the Swarm are drained of their natural resources and rendered barren places known as huskworlds. What outsiders consider to be "Swarm space" is little more than a swathe of lifeless worlds that the Swarm have consumed in its reckless advance. The Swarm so thoroughly strips these worlds that surveyors struggle to find even trace amounts of inorganic resources, such as rare minerals and water. Few of these huskworlds have been thoroughly explored, as oftentimes exploration awakens inert drones, theorized to have been left behind in case the devoured system was ever colonized and repopulated. Pockets of Swarm activity exist well beyond this region of space, as the Swarm sent out countless subcolonies in the ages before the Gap, and even now, only some of them have reached their intended destinations.

The Swarm is perhaps most known in the current era for two important facts. First, its assault on the Pact Worlds and the Veskarium led to the cessation of hostilities and tenuous alliance between the two powers. Second, the Swarm is the direct ancestor of the shirren species. Having broken away sometime during the Gap, shirrens found succor with the deity Hylax, who was believed to have evolved from a pre-Swarm kucharn and who turned her back on the ravenous entity the Swarm has evolved into.

In recent years, the Swarm had been seen as little more than a distant boogeyman with no activities save for classified actions in the Suskillon system in the Vast. However, the recent discovery of the missing Szandite world of Krethiskar inadvertently awoke a dormant subcolony that had been responsible for the world's consumption. Since then, the newly dubbed Krethiskar subcolony has become a scourge of Near Space, engaged in an active invasion of Szandite Collective worlds and poised to spill over into other powers like the Veskarium and Pact Worlds. This rediscovered subcolony has begun rapid evolution of its components and remains cut off from the wider Swarm, but it still represents a clear danger to Near Space.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A bastorox can sense nearby creatures through vibrations in air or water caused by movement as an imprecise sense at the listed range.

action->Colony Mind.name: Colony Mind
action->Colony Mind.description: 30 feet. All allies with colony mind within the listed range of each other are in constant telepathic communication and are aware of all threats any individual knows about. While within range of at least one ally with colony mind, when a creature rolls a success on a save against a mental effect, it gets a critical success instead.

action->Raise a Shield.name: Raise a Shield
action->Raise a Shield.description:
Requirements You are wielding a shield.

You position your shield to protect yourself. When you have Raised a Shield, you gain its listed circumstance bonus to AC. Your shield remains raised until the start of your next turn.

action->Shield Arm.name: Shield Arm
action->Shield Arm.description: A bastorox's battering arm can also be used as a shield (Hardness 5, 30 HP, BT 15). If the shield is destroyed, the bastorox takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls made with its battering arm Strikes. A destroyed shield arm regenerates over the course of 24 hours.

action->Bioelectric Jolt.name: Bioelectric Jolt
action->Bioelectric Jolt.description: The bastorox unleashes a bolt of bioelectric energy from its arm blade. The bolt deals @Damage[6d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:30] with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect] save. The bastorox can't use Bioelectric Jolt again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Bioelectric Jolt]]{1d4 rounds}.

Biotech Advanced War Machine.name: Biotech Advanced War Machine
Biotech Advanced War Machine.publicNotes:
Strong and ferocious, code name "thermatrod" is designed to maximize carnage and destruction on a battlefield. In contrast, the "vracinea" is among the weakest of the unidentified biotech war machines observed in the Pact Worlds. Sleek and stealthy, it darts in and out of enemy defenses while transmitting data to its pilot before departing. If discovered, the vracinea consumes itself to destroy records of the data it was carrying.

The incursion began with a series of probes detected by anacites on Aballon. Strange machines with blazing sensors and articulated tentacles appeared out of nowhere, ripping through infrastructure seemingly at random and collecting intelligence all around Pact Worlds space. Panic spread fast, but since the machines always vanished without a trace, or exploded when captured, the sightings couldn't be confirmed or identified. Rumors began to circulate that the machines were a form of biotech never encountered before. Soon the Stewards became formally involved, shuttering the incidents behind the adamantine partition of top security clearance.

In Sarenith of 325 ag, after dozens of military operations failed to engage the elusive probes, a wing of fighters dispatched from the Idari finally got lucky and disabled one of the machines before it could self-destruct. Coaxed into giving up some of its secrets by top Pact Worlds scientists, the biotech vessel became the prototype for the "home grown" remote war machines that are currently being tested for use in combat. The replicas aren't alive but are built using robotic construction templates since the core of the original biotech design has proven too complicated to reverse engineer with Pact technology.

Remote war machines are proxies that can be controlled from a great distance. The original biotech war machines connect to the pilot's mind through a psychic link or unknown radio frequency. Robotic remote war machines connect to a computer via data link, allowing the pilot to control their proxy using a keyboard, virtual reality rig, or even a vidgame controller.

action->Interstellar Comms.name: Interstellar Comms
action->Interstellar Comms.description: A remote war machine maintains a constant data link with its pilot, using its pilot's languages and skill modifiers for any unlisted skill. In addition, the pilot can speak through the data link using the remote war machine as a mouthpiece.

action->Corpse Flower.name: Corpse Flower
action->Corpse Flower.description:
Trigger The war machine would be reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The war machine self-destructs, dealing @Damage[8d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save) to all creatures in a 60-foot radius. For 1 minute after this ability is used, any creature that touches the war machine's remains is exposed to incredible radiation sickness.

action->Thermal Shadow.name: Thermal Shadow
action->Thermal Shadow.description: 10 feet. The war machine collects and reflects thermal energy to mask its presence. Any creatures targeting the war machine from outside the aura treats it as if it were @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} unless they possess scent or a non-visual–based sense.

action->Hypersonic Burst.name: Hypersonic Burst
action->Hypersonic Burst.description: The war machine Steps or Strides twice. The war machine gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these moves.

action->Transmit Memory.name: Transmit Memory
action->Transmit Memory.description: When a war machine makes an aurora beam Strike against a creature, it absorbs one of the target's memories and remotely transmits the information to its pilot. The target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25|options:inflicts:stupefied] saving throw or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Biotech Giant.name: Biotech Giant
Biotech Giant.publicNotes:
For eons, these giants traveled across the stars searching for a home. While exploring a potential new home in the Vast, they were overrun by a strange fungus that consumed everything they touched. The giants' size protected them from immediate annihilation, but most could only watch as the mycelium's blue-green tendrils covered their new home. In desperation, the giants devoted all their resources to science to find some way to eradicate the fungus. Instead, they learned how to adapt. The giants began living symbiotically with the fungus, grafting it onto their skin and incorporating it into their technology. Now, these giants explore the galaxy as scientists and preservers of myriad ecosystems. While they're most often found providing their scientific expertise to other species, a growing movement of daredevil explorers known as sporerunners travel some of the most dangerous locations in the galaxy on a quest to find a planet they can call home.

Giants are enormous humanoids of many varieties who live all across the galaxy.

action->Electrified Mycelium.name: Electrified Mycelium
action->Electrified Mycelium.description: 10 feet. At the beginning of their turn, while the biotech giant is in contact with the ground, they can extend fungal tendrils from their body, starting as a 10-foot aura and increasing or decreasing by an additional 5 feet per turn as the giant wishes at the start of their turn. Any creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes @Damage[5d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic|options:area-effect] save). When the giant Steps or Strides, they end their current aura and leave behind fungal ground cover in those spaces, starting a new aura at the beginning of their next turn.

action->Fungal Ground Cover.name: Fungal Ground Cover
action->Fungal Ground Cover.description: Any creature that starts its turn in an area of fungal ground cover must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:26|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[3d8[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage. This area is also difficult terrain for creatures other than biotech giants and fungus. Any amount of fire damage automatically destroys a square of fungal ground cover.

action->Mycelial Rewiring.name: Mycelial Rewiring
action->Mycelial Rewiring.description: When the biotech giant Strikes a creature with their mycelial whip or spore cannon, they leave some of the fungus behind, which immediately attempts to graft itself onto the targeted creature. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save; on a failure, its implanted augmentations that count toward its implant limit cease to function for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Biotech Superior War Machine.name: Biotech Superior War Machine
Biotech Superior War Machine.publicNotes:
Devised by engineers based on Kalo-Mahoi, the robotic war machine, code name "atlapak," was built for aquatic warfare. Just like its amphibious creators, the atlapak is equally proficient on land. Code name "ksarik" was first observed in a terrifying attack on a Diasporan mining outpost operated by Ulrikka Clanholdings. When unfurled for battle, the ksarik becomes a mass of spiked tentacles and glaring red sensors that can tear through platoons of troopers in minutes.

The incursion began with a series of probes detected by anacites on Aballon. Strange machines with blazing sensors and articulated tentacles appeared out of nowhere, ripping through infrastructure seemingly at random and collecting intelligence all around Pact Worlds space. Panic spread fast, but since the machines always vanished without a trace, or exploded when captured, the sightings couldn't be confirmed or identified. Rumors began to circulate that the machines were a form of biotech never encountered before. Soon the Stewards became formally involved, shuttering the incidents behind the adamantine partition of top security clearance.

In Sarenith of 325 ag, after dozens of military operations failed to engage the elusive probes, a wing of fighters dispatched from the Idari finally got lucky and disabled one of the machines before it could self-destruct. Coaxed into giving up some of its secrets by top Pact Worlds scientists, the biotech vessel became the prototype for the "home grown" remote war machines that are currently being tested for use in combat. The replicas aren't alive but are built using robotic construction templates since the core of the original biotech design has proven too complicated to reverse engineer with Pact technology.

Remote war machines are proxies that can be controlled from a great distance. The original biotech war machines connect to the pilot's mind through a psychic link or unknown radio frequency. Robotic remote war machines connect to a computer via data link, allowing the pilot to control their proxy using a keyboard, virtual reality rig, or even a vidgame controller.

action->Interstellar Comms.name: Interstellar Comms
action->Interstellar Comms.description: A remote war machine maintains a constant data link with its pilot, using its pilot's languages and skill modifiers for any unlisted skill. In addition, the pilot can speak through the data link using the remote war machine as a mouthpiece.

action->Corpse Flower.name: Corpse Flower
action->Corpse Flower.description:
Trigger The war machine would be reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The war machine self-destructs, dealing @Damage[12d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic|options:area-effect] save) to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60-foot radius}. For 1 minute after this ability is used, any creature that touches the war machine's remains is exposed to incredible radiation sickness.

action->Thermal Shadow.name: Thermal Shadow
action->Thermal Shadow.description: 10 feet. The war machine collects and reflects thermal energy to mask its presence. Any creatures targeting the war machine from outside the aura treats it as if it were @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} unless they possess scent or a non-visual–based sense.

action->Tentacle Flurry.name: Tentacle Flurry
action->Tentacle Flurry.description: The war machine makes a tentacle Strike against up to four creatures in reach, rolling the attack and damage roll only once for all targets.

action->Thoughtlance.name: Thoughtlance
action->Thoughtlance.description: A creature touched by one of the war machine's tentacles must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30|options:inflicts:slowed] save, becoming @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on a failure (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). Each time an affected creature ends its turn, its slowed valued decreases by 1.

Biotech Ultimate War Machine.name: Biotech Ultimate War Machine
Biotech Ultimate War Machine.publicNotes:
Only one member of the Stewards has ever encountered the biotechnical horror known as code name "moonflower" and lived to tell the tale—and only after they emerged from a months-long coma. According to her story, a single moonflower war machine was responsible for the massacre of Liavaran moon S-117, which used to house an entire Stewards deep space telescope array and planetary defense battery.

The incursion began with a series of probes detected by anacites on Aballon. Strange machines with blazing sensors and articulated tentacles appeared out of nowhere, ripping through infrastructure seemingly at random and collecting intelligence all around Pact Worlds space. Panic spread fast, but since the machines always vanished without a trace, or exploded when captured, the sightings couldn't be confirmed or identified. Rumors began to circulate that the machines were a form of biotech never encountered before. Soon the Stewards became formally involved, shuttering the incidents behind the adamantine partition of top security clearance.

In Sarenith of 325 ag, after dozens of military operations failed to engage the elusive probes, a wing of fighters dispatched from the Idari finally got lucky and disabled one of the machines before it could self-destruct. Coaxed into giving up some of its secrets by top Pact Worlds scientists, the biotech vessel became the prototype for the "home grown" remote war machines that are currently being tested for use in combat. The replicas aren't alive but are built using robotic construction templates since the core of the original biotech design has proven too complicated to reverse engineer with Pact technology.

Remote war machines are proxies that can be controlled from a great distance. The original biotech war machines connect to the pilot's mind through a psychic link or unknown radio frequency. Robotic remote war machines connect to a computer via data link, allowing the pilot to control their proxy using a keyboard, virtual reality rig, or even a vidgame controller.

action->Constant Pulse Radar.name: Constant Pulse Radar
action->Constant Pulse Radar.description: The war machine can detect all creatures and objects within 100 feet of itself, treating hidden, invisible, and unobserved creatures as @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}.

action->Interstellar Comms.name: Interstellar Comms
action->Interstellar Comms.description: A remote war machine maintains a constant data link with its pilot, using its pilot's languages and skill modifiers for any unlisted skill. In addition, the pilot can speak through the data link using the remote war machine as a mouthpiece.

action->Corpse Flower.name: Corpse Flower
action->Corpse Flower.description:
Trigger The war machine would be reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The war machine self-destructs, dealing @Damage[16d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic|options:area-effect] save) to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60-foot radius}. For 1 minute after this ability is used, any creature that touches the war machine's remains is exposed to incredible radiation sickness.

action->Psionic Flare.name: Psionic Flare
action->Psionic Flare.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet of the war machine Casts a Spell

Effect The war machine fires a focused lightning beam targeting only the triggering creature. If the creature fails its save, the spell becomes weakened. If the weakened spell requires a saving throw, the target uses the outcome one degree of success better than the result of its roll. If the weakened spell requires a spell attack, that attack roll takes a –4 circumstance penalty.

action->Radio Silence.name: Radio Silence
action->Radio Silence.description: 60 feet. Non-allied comm units and other computers don't function within the remote war machine's aura unless their operator succeeds at a @Check[computers|against:stealth|rollerRole:target] check against the war machine's Stealth DC as an Interact action.

action->Swirling Shield.name: Swirling Shield
action->Swirling Shield.description:
1 to 3

The remote war machine's tentacles surround it in defensive patterns. For 1 minute, it gains a number of reactions equal to the number of actions spent on Swirling Shield. These extra reactions can be used only for Psionic Flare or Reactive Strike.

action->Tentacle Flurry.name: Tentacle Flurry
action->Tentacle Flurry.description: The war machine makes a tentacle Strike against up to four creatures in reach, rolling the attack and damage roll only once for all targets.

action->Thermal Camouflage.name: Thermal Camouflage
action->Thermal Camouflage.description: The war machine becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 minute or until it attempts to make a Strike.

Blight Drake.name: Blight Drake
Blight Drake.publicNotes:
Blight drakes have a well-earned reputation among draconic creatures for stench and pollution. They corrupt the air around them with the sort of filth and decay commonly found in the worst kinds of industrialization. These solitary monstrosities resemble their swamp-dwelling draconic cousins but are often surrounded with a miasma of thick, choking smog. Blight drakes revel in befouling clean and verdant environments, leaving a permanent trail of filth in their wake.

Drakes resemble their larger draconic cousins in more than just scaled, monstrous acclaim. Ranging in size from the diminutive fey drake to the massive, ship-sized star drake, drakes share a dragons' winged reptilian form, long necks, and breath weapons. But where dragons often have forelimbs and wings, a drake typically only has one or the other. Their long, winding tails and sharp jaws more than make up for this lack, however.

Despite being more animalistic than dragons, drakes still possess a formidable cunning, and most share a dragon's ability to generate some form of breath weapon. However, their lack of intelligence makes drakes substantially easier to domesticate than other draconic creatures, and their familial nature makes them excellent pack hunters.

action->Wing Deflection.name: Wing Deflection
action->Wing Deflection.description:
Trigger The blight drake is targeted with an attack from a creature they can see

Effect The blight drake raises their wing, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the blight drake is flying, they descend 10 feet after the attack is complete.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The drake makes two jaws Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Smokestack.name: Smokestack
action->Smokestack.description:
The blight drake blasts a thick, fetid smog from slits around their neck, creating a cloud of smoke in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet and that remains for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
