Any who manage to survive these ordeals expand their sphere of influence by infesting tech infrastructure and taking control of robots they can use as bodyguards and proxies. Malevolent AIs with access to weapons of mass destruction pose a threat to the entire galaxy.

action->Housing Unit.name: Housing Unit
action->Housing Unit.description: A malevolent AI has no body. Instead, they resides in a computer (which itself might be housed in a hazard, starship, structure, or vehicle) or in a construct creature with the tech trait. While inhabiting a construct creature, they can use any of the creature's abilities that are purely physical, and they can't use any of their own abilities except spells and purely mental abilities. The malevolent AI uses the creature's attack modifier, AC, Fortitude save, Reflex save, Perception, and physical skill modifiers, and their own Will save and mental skill modifiers. The malevolent AI must use their own actions to make the creature act. The malevolent AI takes mental damage whenever the creature they possess would take mental damage, even if they're normally immune to it.

action->Shortwave.name: Shortwave
action->Shortwave.description: A malevolent AI can communicate wirelessly with any creatures within their sphere of influence, as long as they have the shortwave ability or are a creature with the tech trait. They can attempt Computers checks to Hack and Thievery checks to Disable a Device on items with the tech trait within their range.

action->Sphere of Influence.name: Sphere of Influence
action->Sphere of Influence.description: A malevolent AI can sense and access all tech within their network, which usually encompasses a room, a vehicle or starship, an entire facility, or more (as determined by the GM).

action->Code Injection.name: Code Injection
action->Code Injection.description:
30 feet. Creatures and items with the tech trait that enter or begin their turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36] save. The malevolent AI can choose to exclude targets.

Critical Success No effect, and the target is temporarily immune to code injection for 1 hour.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} while in the aura and for 1 round after leaving the aura.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2} and 2 rounds.

action->Countdown.name: Countdown
action->Countdown.description:
Trigger The malevolent AI is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The AI gains access to the Self-Destruct reaction unless an adjacent creature succeeds at a @Check[computers|dc:36], Engineering Lore, or Thievery check to Disable the Countdown.

action->Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
action->Self-Destruct.description:
Trigger A creature fails to Disable the Countdown

Effect The malevolent AI's shell explodes, dealing @Damage[8d6[piercing]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[8d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:36|basic] save).

action->Shell Computer.name: Shell Computer
action->Shell Computer.description: The malevolent AI is specifically reinforced in a shell, granting the AI Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage they take by an amount equal to their Hardness. The shell can be targeted by attacks separately from its host. Once the malevolent AI's shell is reduced to half their Hit Points, or immediately after being damaged by a critical hit, the shell becomes broken, removing the AI's Hardness and reducing their Armor Class to 33.

action->Construct Override.name: Construct Override
action->Construct Override.description: The malevolent AI attempts to possess a construct creature with the tech trait within 30 feet. This has the same effect as a 7th-rank @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell (DC 36; applies even if the construct is immune to mental) with an unlimited duration. If the effect ends due to the host body being destroyed or deactivated, the AI is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

action->Contingency Backup.name: Contingency Backup
action->Contingency Backup.description: The malevolent AI creates a dormant backup on a computer within their sphere of influence. When the AI is destroyed, their soul flees to this backup. The backup auto-restores the AI in [[/r 1d20]] hours, allowing that computer to become a new shell. To prevent the AI from returning, both their shell and the backup must be destroyed.

action->Ingenious Stratagem.name: Ingenious Stratagem
action->Ingenious Stratagem.description: The malevolent AI instantly simulates a situation to assess a probable outcome. They choose a target and roll a [[/r 1d20]]. If they Strike or attempt a skill check against that target in the same round, they must use the die roll from Ingenious Stratagem. They makes this substitution only for the first check against the target, not subsequent attempts.

Moon Giant.name: Moon Giant
Moon Giant.publicNotes:
Moon giants are among the largest humanoids, standing approximately 24 feet tall. Their weight varies greatly depending on the locality, as their mass increases with the number of lunar bodies orbiting their current location, though this quality never seems to affect their mobility. Moon giants are calm and even-tempered for the most part, but lunar phases and celestial occurrences influence them easily, and anyone approaching them would be wise to consult the stars first. These giants often work as oracles, receiving gifts or offerings from pilgrims in exchange for their services.

Giants are enormous humanoids of many varieties who live all across the galaxy.

action->Gravitic Control.name: Gravitic Control
action->Gravitic Control.description: The moon giant changes gravity in a 20-foot radius burst anywhere within 60 feet. Gravity in the area is treated as one step higher or lower, such as from zero gravity to low gravity, for 1 minute or until they use this ability again, whichever comes first.

action->Lunar Phase.name: Lunar Phase
action->Lunar Phase.description:
60 feet. The moon giant can choose waxing or waning at the start of each of their turns. When the aura is waxing, a living creature that starts its turn in the aura gains the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition and can use this extra action to only to Stride or Strike. When the aura is waning, a creature that isn't a moon giant that enters the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. This is an incapacitation effect. It's then temporarily immune to the effects of the waning aura for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} while in the aura.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} while in the aura.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} but can still wake up due to a successful Perception check. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

Moonflower.name: Moonflower
Moonflower.publicNotes:
These enormous plants have thick, knotted trunks festooned with fanged blossoms. A gaping mouth opens from the top of the trunk, capable of swallowing most creatures smaller than the moonflower. Moonflowers can move slowly and attack with their powerful roots, but they usually dig deeply into the surrounding ground and remain stationary to ambush prey.

Though moonflowers can't speak in the conventional sense, they communicate telepathically with other moonflowers. Those who manage to intercept a moonflower's telepathic communications are assaulted by visions of primeval jungles ruled over by titanic plant life. Whether this vision is a genetic memory or a dream of the future shared by all moonflowers is unknown.

Moonflowers first sprouted on a long-dead planet, but their proliferation throughout the galaxy has been perpetuated by both random dispersal and sinister intent. Moonflower groves thrive on Castrovel and other worlds with undisturbed wilderness.

action->Pod Prison.name: Pod Prison
action->Pod Prison.description:
Trigger The moonflower has swallowed a creature

Effect The swallowed creature is wrapped in a tight cocoon and extruded from the moonflower's body into an adjacent square. The creature continues to be Swallowed Whole. It can't use Acrobatics to Escape a pod, but other creatures can attempt to Rupture the pod. The cocooned creature takes half damage from any damage dealt to the cocoon. Once the cocoon is Ruptured, it deflates and decays.

action->Pod Spawn.name: Pod Spawn
action->Pod Spawn.description: If a Small or larger creature dies within a Pod Prison, the pod transforms into an adult moonflower with full Hit Points after [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} of growth. The newly formed moonflower has its own consciousness, but some aspect of its trunk or blossoms typically resemble the creature that died within. The dead creature's equipment remains inside the new moonflower and can be retrieved if the moonflower is slain.

action->Light Pulse.name: Light Pulse
action->Light Pulse.description:
The moonflower releases a pulse of bright light. Each non-moonflower creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:50] must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. The moonflower can't use Light Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Light Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Mutant Troll.name: Mutant Troll
Mutant Troll.publicNotes:
Mutant trolls come into the Universe kicking and screaming, barely aware of their surroundings. They bite and claw at anyone who comes near, though no one knows for sure how they come into existence. They take shelter in broken-down reactors and hazardous waste dumps throughout the galaxy. Sometimes, mutant trolls puzzle together bits of tech to craft themselves a jetpack or rocket pod for propulsion to escape these sites and seek gory pleasures elsewhere.

These trolls vary greatly in appearance, but they tend to have droopy skin and hair, a side effect of their twisted regenerative powers. One of the few things mutant trolls love is to bask in the glow of a broken reactor system. They take rapturous joy in the feel of radiation washing over their skin—they speak to themselves in hushed tones about ancient kin who filled their bodies with so much radiation that they acquired primal magic powers.

action->Mauling Flurry.name: Mauling Flurry
action->Mauling Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The mutant troll makes two claw Strikes against one target without increasing their multiple attack penalty. If both Strikes deal damage, the troll can attempt a jaw Strike against that target with the normal multiple attack penalty.

action->Mutated Split.name: Mutated Split
action->Mutated Split.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The mutant troll rips themself apart into two separate Large-sized entities, sharing one fractured sentience between them. While in this form, the mutant troll halves share a communal Hit Point pool and have 4 actions to share between them on their turn. If both halves are included in an area of effect, they must both attempt saving throws, taking the worse result, but only taking damage once.

action->Reforming Merge.name: Reforming Merge
action->Reforming Merge.description:
Requirements The mutant troll halves are adjacent to each other

Effect The mutant troll halves re-form into a single entity.

action->Splurting Slime.name: Splurting Slime
action->Splurting Slime.description:
Requirements The mutant troll is in its Mutated Split form, and both halves are within 30 feet of each other

Effect The duplicated beings spray mutated flesh and organs toward each other, absorbing most of the pieces but raining down acidic viscera on any creatures caught in the 10-foot-wide line between them. These creatures take @Damage[8d8[acid]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:27] save. The troll can't use Splurting Slime again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Splurting Slime]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Necrolinked Wight.name: Necrolinked Wight
Necrolinked Wight.publicNotes: Hollow-eyed undead born from those who died obsessing over social media, necrolinked wights wander both the living and virtual worlds, desperate for engagement and relevance. They're incapable of seeing living creatures as anything more than potential followers, hunting those who engage with technology in the hopes of turning them into obsessed fans. They constantly wail in a condensed magitech code as though screeching at some long-forgotten online debate in an attempt to grab the attention of others by overriding devices with content supernaturally configured to vie for attention. Yet as soon as their victims become necrolinked, they lose interest, driven by the same dark necrotic algorithm.

equipment->Comm Unit.name: Comm Unit
equipment->Comm Unit.description:
A personal comm unit is a pocket-sized device that combines a minor portable computer and a cellular communications device, allowing instantaneous wireless communication with other comm units in both audio- and text-based formats at planetary range. A personal comm unit also includes a calculator, a flashlight (emits bright light in a 5-foot radius around you and dim light in the next 5 feet), a browser that accesses any local infospheres, and several entertainment options (including games).

Personal comm units integrated into armor have some voice-activated capabilities; you can communicate with other comm units in audio-based formats and receive responses without needing a free hand, but typing a message, browsing the infosphere, or using an app requires the use of at least one hand.

Comm units that function at longer ranges aren't as portable; they include built-in generators that provide the necessary amount of power and rely on active Drift beacons to communicate. Short-term use of these units can be purchased in most major settlements.

action->Aligned Comm Unit.name: Aligned Comm Unit
action->Aligned Comm Unit.description: The comm unit of a necrolinked wight can be disabled for 1 hour with a successful DC 15 check to Disable a Device or Disable a System. A necrolinked wight with a disabled comm unit is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, gains a +6 bonus to Perception, and can't Check its Feed.

action->Social Media Addiction.name: Social Media Addiction
action->Social Media Addiction.description: The necrolinked wight is driven by a desire to continue their cycles of spiteful hatred and media consumption on the infosphere. They spend their first action of each round to Check Feed. Eternally obsessed, a necrolinked wight will always try to stay within range of an active infosphere signal. A necrolinked wight with no infosphere access or perceived threats functions as if their aligned comm unit was disabled and does whatever it can to regain infosphere access.

action->Check Feed.name: Check Feed
action->Check Feed.description: The necrolinked wight looks up information on their aligned comm unit about a specific creature using Computers instead of any other skill. On a success, the creature takes a –2 status penalty to its next Will save against necrotic transmission for 1 minute ( –3 status penalty on a critical success).

action->Necrotic Transmission.name: Necrotic Transmission
action->Necrotic Transmission.description: A creature that takes damage from a necrolinked wight's Shriek must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:15] save, or its subconscious is scanned and used to infect its non-augmentation tech items with a virus. Infected tech items display algorithmically generated content catering specifically to the creature's deepest desires, causing the creature to become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as they're holding or wearing the tech item. On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, and all creatures and objects other than the tech item are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from the creature. The creature or its allies can end the effect on any specific tech item by Interacting to reboot the affected item and succeeding at a @Check[computers|dc:15] check; on a failure, the item becomes glitching 1 (glitching 2 on a critical failure).

action->Spawn Registration.name: Spawn Registration
action->Spawn Registration.description: A living creature that dies while @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by necrotic transmission rises as a necrolinked wight after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

equipment->Aeon Stone (Uplifting).name: Aeon Stone (Uplifting)
equipment->Aeon Stone (Uplifting).description:
Staple items within the Azlanti Star Empire, these gemstones are popular status symbols for adventurers and wealthy collectors. Despite their myriad forms and functions, these stones are purportedly all fragments of crystal tools used by otherworldly entities to build the Universe in ancient times.

When you invest one of these precisely shaped crystals, the stone orbits your head (or another visible part of your anatomy if you don't have a head) instead of being worn on your body. You can stow an aeon stone with an Interact action, and an orbiting stone can be snatched out of the air with a successful @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} action against you. A stowed or removed stone remains invested, but its effects are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} until you return it to orbit your head again.

There are various types of aeon stones, each with a different appearance and magical effect. Each aeon stone also gains a resonant power when slotted into specific items, such as weapons with the aeon trait or antique magical devices called wayfinders.

This deep-blue prism with cloudy inclusions is light as a feather. Its resonant power gives you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Activate—Fly Free 1 (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain a fly Speed for 1 minute equal to your Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment-effects.Item.xZ5XMY55S42aGyjg]{Effect: Aeon Stone (Uplifting)}

action->Clear Mind.name: Clear Mind
action->Clear Mind.description:
Trigger The necrovite is targeted by a spell with the emotion trait

Effect The necrovite attempts to counteract the triggering spell (counteract rank 7, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+30 #Counteract]]{+30}). If the spell is disrupted, the necrovite gains temporary Hit Points equal to twice the rank of the counteracted spell that last for 1 minute.

action->Fatiguing Presence.name: Fatiguing Presence
action->Fatiguing Presence.description: 30 feet. A creature that first enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the necrovite's fatiguing presence for 24 hours.

action->Entropic Touch.name: Entropic Touch
action->Entropic Touch.description: Void damage dealt by a necrovite damages undead and creatures with void healing as if it were vitality damage. A necrovite's melee Strikes have the benefits of the ghost killer upgrade on attacks against incorporeal undead.

action->Painful Mark.name: Painful Mark
action->Painful Mark.description: When the necrovite damages a living creature with its wrackstaff, the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further wrackstaff damage increases the drain value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a necrovite is destroyed, their consciousness is immediately transferred to their electroencephalon. A necrovite can be permanently destroyed only if their electroencephalon is found and destroyed. Immunities bleed, death effects, disease, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, poison, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}

action->Scramble Psyche.name: Scramble Psyche
action->Scramble Psyche.description: The necrovite touches an adjacent creature and scrambles its thought patterns. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:33] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. The necrovite is considered hidden to the confused target for as long as the confusion lasts.

Nihili.name: Nihili
Nihili.publicNotes:
Dying from exposure in space is horrific, and many starship crews obsessively monitor their hull and armor integrity to avoid such a fate. It can also lead to the creation of the foul undead known as nihilis. A nihili arises after an individual in vacuum dies of asphyxiation while all gases exit their body and their lungs collapse from attempts to hold their breath. Legends say the first person to die in such a terrible manner had a vision of the goddess of undeath, Urgathoa, who bestowed upon them a single kiss, transforming them into the very first nihili. The same legends go on to claim that this nihili still floats aimlessly through space, waiting to cling to an unsuspecting starship.

The physical appearance of a given nihili varies. Most appear as zombie-like versions of their respective ancestries, but with gruesome stretch marks and pockets of bloat caused by escaping gases during their death. A nihili maintains their prior intellect, subverted entirely to inflicting the same suffering on the living that they endured. By focusing their gaze on a target, a nihili can impart to that creature the memories of their own demise, potentially suffocating them.

weapon->Laser Rifle.name: Laser Rifle
weapon->Laser Rifle.description:
Upgrades: 1

These dependable, mass-produced rifles shoot concentrated beams of energy out of square-shaped barrels. The universal standard Pact Worlds model is highly modifiable and designed to function with a variety of accessories and upgrades, with wielders adapting the laser rifle to their preferences and even kit-bashing it into a nearly unrecognizable weapon.

action->Decompressing Glance.name: Decompressing Glance
action->Decompressing Glance.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet that the nihili can see starts its turn

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save. If it fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 1 minute as it struggles to catch its breath.

action->Decompressing Gaze.name: Decompressing Gaze
action->Decompressing Gaze.description:
The nihili stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet and imparts vivid visions of their prior death by decompression. A creature affected by this gaze must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save. If it fails and hasn't already been @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} by Decompressing Glance or this ability, it becomes fatigued. If the creature is already fatigued, a failed save causes the creature to begin suffocating until the end of the nihili's next turn. The creature remains conscious and can take actions on its turn, such as casting a spell or searching for a source of air. The creature can hold its breath as normal.

A creature can attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save at the end of its turn to break free from the experience being projected into its mind; on a success, the effect of Decompressing Gaze ends. The nihili can Sustain Decompressing Gaze on their turn or end this effect as a free action. The targeted creature's access to air is restored when the nihili targets a new creature with their Decompressing Gaze or the creature successfully saves against the effects. This otherwise follows the rules for suffocation.

action->Gravity Grab.name: Gravity Grab
action->Gravity Grab.description:
The nihili generates a field of gravity that pulls all creatures and unsecured objects toward it. Each creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is pulled 5 feet toward the nihili.

Failure The creature is pulled 15 feet toward the nihili.

Critical Failure The creature is pulled 30 feet toward the nihili.

Noquasar Spark.name: Noquasar Spark
Noquasar Spark.publicNotes:
A noquasar spark appears as a glimmer of intensely bright light with an agonized face.

When a solarian perishes while out of sync with the cycle of stars, their soul might become entangled with their solar mote. Extreme cosmic forces act on the soul as it attempts to reach the River of Souls, stretching it infinitely thin for all of eternity.

action->Gravity Lurch.name: Gravity Lurch
action->Gravity Lurch.description: A creature critically hit by a noquasar spark's graviton flare is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Ionized Plasma Blast.name: Ionized Plasma Blast
action->Ionized Plasma Blast.description: The noquasar spark unleashes plasma in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] or @Template[type:line|distance:30]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[2d4[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). A creature that critically fails its save also takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,electricity]|options:area-damage] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The noquasar spark can't use Ionized Plasma Blast again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Ionized Plasma Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Nyssholora.name: Nyssholora
Nyssholora.publicNotes:
Adult nyssholoras band together in pairs only when mating and raising a newly hatched brood, during which time they consider the borders between their territory communal—they're otherwise extremely territorial.

Incredibly ferocious, nyssholoras are dinosaur-like creatures that number among the most dangerous and feared apex predators on the planet of Castrovel. These walking weapons brandish lethal biology: a massive maw lined with twin rows of razor-sharp teeth, scythe-shaped phasic blade forearms that vibrate at ultrasonic speeds, and a scourge-like tail capable of absorbing electricity from the surrounding atmosphere. Yet, nyssholoras are also cunning and perceptive—a frill of tentacles that crowns their head detect telepathic signals, making it impossible for the local formians and lashuntas to escape their notice. Their phasic blades can cut through walls and vehicles as easily as underbrush, ensuring prey have nowhere safe to hide.

action->Telepathy Sense.name: Telepathy Sense
action->Telepathy Sense.description: A nyssholora senses all creatures that have telepathy, limited telepathy, or a similar ability, such as a mystic's bond, as an imprecise sense at the listed range. This sense works through walls and other obstacles.

action->Crunch.name: Crunch
action->Crunch.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the nyssholora's jaws

Effect The nyssholora chomps down on the creature, dealing @Damage[(1d12+13)[piercing]] damage.

action->Discordant Bellow.name: Discordant Bellow
action->Discordant Bellow.description: The nyssholora unleashes a blast of discordant sound that deal @Damage[12d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save). Objects and constructs in the area are treated as if they had half as much Hardness as usual. Creatures that critically fail their saving throw are also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round. The nyssholora can't use Discordant Bellow again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Discordant Bellow]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Phasic Strike.name: Phasic Strike
action->Phasic Strike.description: A nyssholora's phasic blade Strike treats any object or construct it hits as if the target had half as much Hardness as usual.

Obrhinnshee.name: Obrhinnshee
Obrhinnshee.publicNotes:
Obrhinnshees travel the Universe to expedite the return of fey souls to the First World after they die, preventing psychopomps from bringing them to the Boneyard. They believe the Eldest shouldn't allow the gods to take those they turned their backs on. In addition to this duty, the small fey seem drawn to people in need and feel compelled to render aid if they can. They're most commonly encountered in areas influenced by the First World but can be found traveling any region of space.

An obrhinnshee resembles a gnome with a shock of green, purple, or deep blue hair and glowing marks on their bodies that resemble star charts. These marks glow brighter when an obrhinnshee uses magic or whenever their hammer contains a soul. Obrhinnshees are small but strong creatures who prefer to wreathe themselves in flame and charge into battle, using their spells only if necessary.

weapon->Hammer.name: Hammer
weapon->Hammer.description:
Upgrades: 1

Valued as both a crafting tool and an effective weapon, this hammer uses specially weighted heads and handles to deliver maximum force with each strike.

action->Soul Warden.name: Soul Warden
action->Soul Warden.description:
Trigger A willing fey or creature sworn to serve an Eldest dies within 100 feet of an obrhinnshee

Effect The creature's soul is drawn into the obrhinnshee's hammer to be carried home.

action->Stardust.name: Stardust
action->Stardust.description: When an obrhinnshee dies, they burst into a 10-foot aura of blinding stardust. All non-fey in the area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (dazzled for 1 hour and blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure).

action->Deathly Nimbus.name: Deathly Nimbus
action->Deathly Nimbus.description:
Frequency once per hour

Requirements A soul is contained in the obrhinnshee's hammer

Effect The obrhinnshee wreathes themself in flame. All of the obrhinnshee's Strikes deal an additional @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage for 1 minute.

action->Feyhammer.name: Feyhammer
action->Feyhammer.description: In the hands of an obrhinnshee, all hammers gain a reach of 10 feet and are treated as magical weapons.

action->Minor Wish.name: Minor Wish
action->Minor Wish.description: The obrhinnshee grants a willing creature within 100 feet a +2 circumstance bonus on its next attack roll, check, or saving throw before the end of its next turn. The target becomes immune to Minor Wish for 1 minute.

action->Starlight Charge.name: Starlight Charge
action->Starlight Charge.description: The obrhinnshee Strides twice and makes a melee Strike. On a critical hit using this action with a feyhammer, the target is automatically shoved 10 feet away from the obrhinnshee.

Observer-Class Security Robot.name: Observer-Class Security Robot
Observer-Class Security Robot.publicNotes:
Programmed to patrol small areas, an observer-class security robot is akin to a watch dog, but with a built-in gun. Some manufacturers design these robots with canine forms, and their capability to fly can surprise would-be burglars who were expecting a more terrestrial defense.

Security robots are ubiquitous throughout industrialized space and have major presences in both the Pact Worlds and Veskarium, employed and customized by corporations and private citizens alike.

While most soldier robot models are built to be as destructive as possible, and elimination robots are designed to kill, security robots usually have fail-safes programmed into their behavior to prevent them from causing any more violence than is necessary to perform their designated security function. This makes them especially useful in cities, where unintended destruction might harm bystanders or cause legal issues, and even on starships, where a stray laser blast might cause serious damage to vital starship systems.

weapon->Intergrated Commercial Pulsecast.name: Intergrated Commercial Pulsecaster Pistol
weapon->Intergrated Commercial Pulsecast.description:
Upgrades: 1

This imposing pistol fires a jolt of paralyzing electricity from its barrel. Its remaining charges are visible as glowing lines of energy radiating down its body. Pulsecaster pistols are often used by bounty hunters and law enforcement who need to keep their targets alive.

action->Exigency.name: Exigency
action->Exigency.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature targets the security robot with an attack

Effect The robot overclocks its processing power to attempt to avoid an attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

Oma.name: Oma
Oma.publicNotes:
Also known as space whales, omas project powerful magical electromagnetic fields that protect them from both vacuum and toxic atmospheres while allowing them to feed. Omas gain sustenance from the particulate rings and dense atmospheres of gas giants, although exactly which substances are nutritious to an oma is still unknown. Studying a feeding oma isn't without danger. Omas sometimes accidentally swallow drones and small starships, such as fighters and interceptors, and they've been known to do so deliberately when provoked.

Most omas have been observed traveling alone. On occasion, omas form pods of three to five individuals and migrate across systems, on currents and schedules only they know. In very rare cases, omas gather among the rings of a planet in massive numbers. Their energy fields intermingle and react with local gases to light up large areas of space in a multicolored show.

Their most enigmatic yet well known feature is their starsong. Traveling through space for billions of miles, the starsong is a haunting telepathic melody. Most people perceive starsong as crooning, slow and mournful. No one can agree on the details, suggesting that each listener hears something different. Attempts to translate starsong have failed thus far, stumping even the most brilliant magic and linguistics experts. Since the Drift Crisis, for unknown reasons pods of omas have begun bombarding Drift beacons with a seemingly new starsong frequency, in some cases causing catastrophic malfunctions.

action->Starsong.name: Starsong
action->Starsong.description: While not a language, starsong allows omas to communicate telepathically with one another across space; omas can communicate with other omas in the same star system. Any other creature with telepathy can receive but not necessarily understand starsong at a range of 10,000 miles.

action->Cavatina.name: Cavatina
action->Cavatina.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The oma sings a telepathic song that encourages its friends and dispirits its foes within 120 feet. Each ally who can hear the song gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks for 1 minute. Each enemy must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical failure), as the song affects their inner ear.

action->Overloading Shock.name: Overloading Shock
action->Overloading Shock.description: When an oma scores a critical hit with its electric discharge Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save or all tech items held by the target become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2}.

Omnipath.name: Omnipath
Omnipath.publicNotes: Omnipaths are military leaders who pilot god-killing starships or command fleets of remote war machines. Omnipaths achieve their lofty positions through ambition and have few scruples, never hesitating to control other beings when it suits their schemes. Minds touched by an omnipath often lose important memories when released or, worse, glimpse shards of the omnipath's alien mindscape that linger long after the connection is severed.

action->Nanite Mesh.name: Nanite Mesh
action->Nanite Mesh.description: An omnipath maintains a bond with up to 20 other willing creatures. Creatures in the mesh always know the general distance and direction toward other bonded creatures, any conditions affecting them, and if they're @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, dying, or dead. These creatures can communicate telepathically while on the same plane and can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} using the highest relevant skill modifier of any creature in the mesh. An omnipath can target any creature in its mesh with a mental spell from any distance as long as they can telepathically communicate with it, and any of these spells with the incapacitation trait lose that trait while targeting a creature in the omnipath's mesh.

action->Nanite Projection.name: Nanite Projection
action->Nanite Projection.description: A omnipath can share the senses and read the surface thoughts of creatures affected by their nanite mesh. A voidsage can project its mind into just one creature at a time, and choose which affected creature is the focus of its nanite projection as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The creature also takes a –1 circumstance penalty to Will saves against any of the voidsage's spells as long as it's the focus of the voidsage's nanite projection.

action->Nanite Network.name: Nanite Network
action->Nanite Network.description: An omnipath exudes a cloud of nanites. Creatures in the aura take a –3 status penalty to saving throws against the omnipath's spells and its Merge Minds ability.

action->Revert.name: Revert
action->Revert.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger The omnipath takes damage while projecting

Effect The omnipath stops projecting and gains 100 temporary Hit Points that last for 10 minutes.

action->Merge Minds.name: Merge Minds
action->Merge Minds.description:
The omnipath forces an unwilling creature within 500 feet to join their nanite mesh. The creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:33] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature joins the nanite mesh for 10 minutes.

Critical Failure The creature joins the nanite mesh for 24 hours.

action->Quantum Nanites.name: Quantum Nanites
action->Quantum Nanites.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:33]

Maximum Duration 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 day)

action->Release the Nanites.name: Release the Nanites
action->Release the Nanites.description: The omnipath severs a creature from their nanite mesh. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:33] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round, and the memory of any time spent while inside the nanite mesh is permanently erased; on a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

Ordinance-Class Civil Robot.name: Ordinance-Class Civil Robot
Ordinance-Class Civil Robot.publicNotes:
Ordinance-class civil robots exist to help others learn the local laws, navigate around a location, and generally remind everyone to follow the rules. What they lack in raw strength, they make up for with an extensive database of knowledge. Most of these robots are designed to mimic the shape of prevalent humanoid ancestries, and thus the standard configuration for such robots includes two arms and two legs. Some have been modified with extra attachments, providing maps produced from a rectangular opening in their chest plate or featuring touchscreens that allow passersby to consult every ordinance, law, and other legal documents relevant to the area.

Some pranksters enjoy leaving doodles and other drawings in spots the robot can't easily detect, and thus an ordinance-class civil robot that has been operating for an extensive period of time can be found with a rainbow of shapes, colors, and the occasional advertisement placed on its back.

Civil robots can be found in almost any large settlement, employed by the local government. They aren't meant to function as keepers of the peace, but instead perform minor functions, such as collecting refuse, aiding citizens with information, or collecting taxes. However, they can still defend themselves against vandals if necessary.

weapon->Integrated Commercial Pulsecaste.name: Integrated Commercial Pulsecaster Pistol
weapon->Integrated Commercial Pulsecaste.description:
Upgrades: 1

This imposing pistol fires a jolt of paralyzing electricity from its barrel. Its remaining charges are visible as glowing lines of energy radiating down its body. Pulsecaster pistols are often used by bounty hunters and law enforcement who need to keep their targets alive.

equipment->Flashlight (Commercial).name: Flashlight (Commercial)
equipment->Flashlight (Commercial).description: A flashlight sheds bright light. A commercial flashlight emits light in a 30-foot emanation (and dim light in the next 30 feet).

equipment->Medkit (Commercial).name: Medkit (Commercial)
equipment->Medkit (Commercial).description: These contain analgesics, bandages, sterile gauze, and suturing tools necessary for Medicine checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison}, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}.

action->Exigency.name: Exigency
action->Exigency.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature targets the robot with an attack

Effect The robot overclocks its processing power to dodge, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

action->Photographic Recall.name: Photographic Recall
action->Photographic Recall.description: After receiving a request for information about a named location or a local law from a non-hostile creature, the ordinance-class robot spends 5 minutes to consult its database, automatically succeeding at a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check to answer the question. At the GM's discretion, the information might not be available to the robot.

action->Scrutinize.name: Scrutinize
action->Scrutinize.description: The ordinance-class civil robot scans all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], attempting a single Legal Lore check and comparing the result to the Deception DC of each creature in the area. If the robot succeeds and the creature is known to have broken local laws, the robot gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Strikes and Athletics checks to [[/act grapple]] the creature for 24 hours.

Orocoran.name: Orocoran
Orocoran.publicNotes:
Most orocorans latch onto the shards of Aucturn that were cast through space or scattered throughout the Gelid Edge, consuming what fragments of the Newborn's womb they can and attacking anyone who happens upon them in a wild feeding frenzy. Orocorans act with especially intense and unrelenting violence toward anyone trying to harvest or relocate aucturnite.

Native to the now-destroyed planet of Aucturn, orocorans are foul and desperate creatures, cast adrift in space as they yearn to consume once more the essence of the Newborn god or fragments of the womb it gestated within. They're irritable, violent, and utterly anguished.

While some orocorans have broken free of their addiction and regained their clarity of mind and sense of self, the orocorans presented here are those who still rely on Aucturn's eldritch fluids.
Orocoran.languagesDetails: Can't speak any language, Telepathy 60 feet page 210

action->Hallucinate.name: Hallucinate
action->Hallucinate.description:
An orocoran's stomach fluids are laced with hallucinogens due to their consumption of the ichor-like birthing fluids expelled by Aucturn during the hatching of the Newborn.

A creature hit with the projectile vomit must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round ([[/r 1d4]] rounds on a critical failure).

action->Lick Wounds.name: Lick Wounds
action->Lick Wounds.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements A creature within reach of the orocoran's proboscis is taking persistent bleed damage

Effect The orocoran flicks out their proboscis and sups on the flowing blood of their enemy. The orocoran regains Hit Points equal to the target's persistent bleed value.

action->Spew Vomit.name: Spew Vomit
action->Spew Vomit.description: The orocoran spews vomit in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], dealing @Damage[3d6[acid]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[will|dc:24|basic] save). Creatures that fail their save are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round ([[/r 1d4]] rounds on a critical failure). This confusion is a mental effect.

Oscriss.name: Oscriss
Oscriss.publicNotes:
The menacing war machines known as the oscriss are found only in the ancient sites associated with the First Ones. Resembling two stacked pyramids with a white energy core of unknown composition, oscriss infuriate foes by routinely teleporting across the battlefield. Found wandering alone throughout Aballon's First One cities, the war machines were later identified in locations outside the Pact Worlds, lending credence to theories of the First Ones' expansion efforts throughout the cosmos.

The oscriss defy proper engagement, staying far away from their foes and unleashing coruscating beams of energy that slice off the limbs of those unlucky enough to engage with them. They meticulously render their foes apart at extreme range using pinpoint accuracy. If pressured into a close-range engagement, they can unleash a blast of chronal energy to slow their attackers and allow themselves the time to better reposition and continue their dismembering bombardment.

Like other constructs of the First Ones, these guardians refuse to communicate and defy almost all attempts to override or hack their programming. Some of the galaxy's finest minds have managed to temporarily overcome the intricate programming within the oscriss, though such intrusions are quickly detected and repelled, indicating that an evolving intelligence dwells within each of the strange machines.

When engaged at multiple vectors, it becomes easy to overwhelm an oscriss's detection grid and reactions. Anacite scholars propose that the constructs were fashioned to battle foes who engaged strictly in two-dimensional warfare, and while the oscriss themselves are exceptionally capable of acting in three dimensions, they battle as though their foes could engage them only in two.

It's speculated that the unique tactics and weapons employed by the oscriss are intended to deal with one specific threat: the planashars of the Planashar Dominion. The planashars hail from a different reality known as the Infinite Loop that has only two dimensions. They've recently slowly begun invading the galaxy, taking on the title of Those Who Converge and attacking Aballonian First Ones cities and the solar settlement of Noma. That the oscriss are intended to battle them only provides more evidence of some connection between the planashars and the First Ones.

Because the oscriss are accustomed to fighting beings that exist only in two-dimensional space, they're vulnerable to tactics involving three dimensions—attacking from multiple angles, for example. While an oscriss doesn't entirely understand such tactics, they can sense when they're being outmaneuvered with three-dimensional thinking and use their potent teleportation abilities to move into a less vulnerable position at every opportunity.
Oscriss.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic
Oscriss.languagesDetails: First one cant speak any languages, Telepathy 300 feet

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Transposition.name: Transposition
action->Transposition.description:
Trigger A creature takes any move action within 15 feet of the oscriss

Effect The oscriss teleports into an unoccupied space within 30 feet.

action->Two-Dimensional Thinking.name: Two-Dimensional Thinking
action->Two-Dimensional Thinking.description:
An oscriss is designed for fighting two-dimensional foes. If more than one enemy has the oscriss within reach, they count as flanking regardless of their actual position. An oscriss made @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} by flanking foes takes a –3 circumstance penalty to AC (instead of the usual –2).

An oscriss has weakness 15 against melee attacks benefiting from flanking, and whenever a creature scores a critical hit with a melee Strike against the oscriss while flanking them, the oscriss becomes glitching 1.

If the oscriss is already glitching, they instead become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the end of their next turn.

action->Amputating Strikes.name: Amputating Strikes
action->Amputating Strikes.description:
When an oscriss scores a critical hit with their relativity saw or bifurcating beam Strike, the target must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:44] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes an additional @Damage[2d10[slashing]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes an additional @Damage[4d10[slashing]] damage and loses one limb (arm, leg, or a similar ambulatory limb such as a tentacle, randomly determined by the GM).

action->Dimensional Pounce.name: Dimensional Pounce
action->Dimensional Pounce.description: The oscriss Strides up to their Speed or casts translocate; at the end of that movement, the oscriss Strikes. If the oscriss began this action hidden, they remain hidden until after this ability's Strike.

action->Passing Through.name: Passing Through
action->Passing Through.description: The oscriss ignores all non-magical difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

action->Pause Pulse.name: Pause Pulse
action->Pause Pulse.description:
The oscriss releases a pulse of temporal energy in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] that deals @Damage[10d8[force]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area with a @Check[reflex|dc:44] save. The oscriss can't use Pause Pulse again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Pause Pulse]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is slowed 1 for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

action->Secondary Target.name: Secondary Target
action->Secondary Target.description:
Frequency once per round;

Effect The designates a creature within 100 feet to be the secondary target of their attacks until the end of the oscriss's next turn.

Whenever the oscriss makes a Strike against a different creature, they can make the same Strike against their secondary target as a free action, using the same multiple attack penalty as the attack against the initial target. The initial and secondary Strikes count as one attack for the purposes of increasing the oscriss's multiple attack penalty.

action->Whirling Assault.name: Whirling Assault
action->Whirling Assault.description: The oscriss Strikes with their relativity saw six times.

Othinni.name: Othinni
Othinni.publicNotes:
Along Embroi's perilous seas, residents speak in hushed tones of the othinni. Considered by some to be a myth, the enormous, squid-like aberrations supposedly bear sinister glowing runes suggestive of an infernal lineage. Those dragged into the deep by their writhing tentacles and swallowed by their gaping maws are said to go straight to Hell, their final screams fueling the legends.

The myths are true. Othinni possess a cruel intelligence and dominating influence over the minds of mortals. Survivors suffer disturbing visions, intense feelings of fear and confusion, and visions of unholy fire burning atop the waves. Hearing the insidious psychic screech of an othinni or sailing into their massive shadow is a frightful experience for anyone braving the oceans of Embroi.

Angels and their allies hunt othinni with massive holy harpoons and enchanted silver nets. One legendary hunt is recorded in the documentary film Umiqon (produced by Zo! Media), which is named for the 40-foot tall monster brought down by four Knights of Iomedae.

action->Abyssal Ink.name: Abyssal Ink
action->Abyssal Ink.description: 20 feet. The othinni is constantly surrounded by a cloud of poisonous black ink. Any creature that enters the aura or begins its turn inside the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save or becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} for 1 minute (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical failure).

action->Infernal Origin.name: Infernal Origin
action->Infernal Origin.description:
Trigger The othinni is targeted by a magical effect with the holy trait

Effect The othinni's infernal runes flare to life, attempting to counteract the effect (counteract rank 7, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+26 #Counteract]]{+26}).

action->Infernal Binding.name: Infernal Binding
action->Infernal Binding.description: The othinni binds a creature within 100 feet with diabolic runes, and the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is immobilized for 1 minute but can attempt a new saving throw at the start of each of its turns to end the effect.

action->Psychic Screech.name: Psychic Screech
action->Psychic Screech.description:
The othinni unleashes a mental wail in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. All creatures in this area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32] save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for as long as it's frightened.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Pachinyam.name: Pachinyam
Pachinyam.publicNotes:
A single pachinyam isn't much of a threat but can be a nuisance around those who rely on technology. Some pachinyam owners take extra time to play with their pets after their daily dust baths, especially before entering a starship or other facility where an unexpected cloud of dust could have catastrophic consequences.

These dusty, long-eared fluffy burrowing rodents are native to Daimalko and emerged alongside the colossi during the Awakening 200 years ago. They were initially heralded as potential pets and affectionately referred to as "dust bunnies," but the survivors of the Awakening soon found the species were as dangerous as the colossi rampaging across the planet.

While one or two pachinyams behave as calm herbivores, they reproduce rapidly. When the pachinyam population reaches a tipping point, they become vicious predators. Their dust's ability to disrupt both visual and telecommunications makes it challenging for settlements to warn or organize against them. Outside civilization, the pachinyam population is kept in check by their swarms' instinctually drive to be near colossi despite the obvious danger. Some also hypothesize that the scent of a pachinyam swarm's dust cloud attracts hungry colossi.

action->Dusting.name: Dusting
action->Dusting.description: The pachinyam shakes it thick fur and releases a cloud of dust and dander in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] radius centered on a corner of one of its squares that functions as a mist spell. This dust cloud blocks electronic communication to and from anyone inside the cloud. Any item with the tech trait becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 1} if it's inside the dust cloud. The pachinyam can't use this ability again until they take a dust bath as a 3-action activity with the move trait.

Pachinyam Swarm.name: Pachinyam Swarm
Pachinyam Swarm.publicNotes:
Pachinyam swarms can release a cloud of billowing dust as individual rodents constantly reapply dust to their comrades.

These dusty, long-eared fluffy burrowing rodents are native to Daimalko and emerged alongside the colossi during the Awakening 200 years ago. They were initially heralded as potential pets and affectionately referred to as "dust bunnies," but the survivors of the Awakening soon found the species were as dangerous as the colossi rampaging across the planet.

While one or two pachinyams behave as calm herbivores, they reproduce rapidly. When the pachinyam population reaches a tipping point, they become vicious predators. Their dust's ability to disrupt both visual and telecommunications makes it challenging for settlements to warn or organize against them. Outside civilization, the pachinyam population is kept in check by their swarms' instinctually drive to be near colossi despite the obvious danger. Some also hypothesize that the scent of a pachinyam swarm's dust cloud attracts hungry colossi.

action->Dust.name: Dust
action->Dust.description: 30 feet. The pachinyam swarm shakes it thick fur and releases a cloud of dust and dander in a 30-foot radius burst centered on a corner of one of its squares that functions as a mist spell. This dust cloud blocks electronic communication to and from anyone inside the cloud. Any item with the tech trait becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 1} if it's inside the dust cloud.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). Creatures that fail this save are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). While within a pachinyam's dust cloud and sickened, the creature is also suppressed until it leaves the cloud or recovers from the sickened condition.

Paradox 17.name: Paradox 17
Paradox 17.publicNotes:
As Paradox 17 is normally invisible, most recorded observations of it start with hearing a roar "like static from a dead signal." All reports mention a profound yet hard-to-place sense of meaningfulness. One survivor saw it illuminated by a blast of light she described as "a spiral galaxy made up of shining eyes and glass feathers." Another described it as "dozens of interleaved wings scattered with embers." The only thing consistent about Paradox 17, however, is how deadly it can be if confronted directly.

Can you ever really know that the Universe you perceive exists? That you'll never awaken one day to find it was all a dream? A planet full of philosophers sought the answers to these questions once upon a time… shortly before they all vanished en masse. They left behind confusing records stating that the light of a "whirling star" revealed that physical matter had no substance and the Universe was secretly a mental prison. These records are all that remain from the first known encounter with the being known as Paradox 17.

action->Causational Moments.name: Causational Moments
action->Causational Moments.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger A creature would trigger Paradox 17's Reactive Strike, but it has no reactions remaining

Effect Paradox 17 Steps or Strikes prior to resolving the triggering action.

action->Reject Reality.name: Reject Reality
action->Reject Reality.description: 100 feet. When a creature in the aura observes Paradox 17 for the first time each day, it must attempt a @Check[will|dc:42] save or Performance check. On a failure, reality rejects the creature for as long as it can observe Paradox 17. The affected creature becomes hidden from all other creatures (except Paradox 17) as though invisible itself.

action->Bridge of Perception.name: Bridge of Perception
action->Bridge of Perception.description:
Requirements Another creature is observing Paradox 17 or has triggered interdict definition in the last hour

Effect Paradox 17 teleports to any location that both Paradox 17 and the required creature can observe across any distance, even to another galaxy or plane.

action->Disregard Reality.name: Disregard Reality
action->Disregard Reality.description: Paradox 17 can move through all creatures, objects, and structures as though they were incorporeal.

action->Interdict Definition.name: Interdict Definition
action->Interdict Definition.description: Paradox 17 automatically and instantly learns and can observe the exact location of any creature on any plane that succeeds at a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check to learn any information about Paradox 17 or any creature who communicates information about Paradox 17 in any way. The ability to observe the creature and its surroundings, wherever the creature goes, lasts 1 hour.

action->Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
action->Natural Invisibility.description: Paradox 17 is naturally invisible. It becomes visible only when using a hostile action.

action->Waking Light.name: Waking Light
action->Waking Light.description:
Paradox 17 burns away the fabric of reality with intense sunlight. If no creatures are observing Paradox 17, the light fills a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. If any creature is observing Paradox 17, the area is a @Template[type:line|distance:60]. Creatures and unattended objects in the area turn temporarily translucent. Creatures in the area take @Damage[24d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:45] save. Paradox 17 can't use Waking Light again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Waking Light]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The target takes no damage.

Success The target takes half damage becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Failure The target takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 3}.

Paradoxical Solipsist.name: Paradoxical Solipsist
Paradoxical Solipsist.publicNotes:
On six recorded occasions, individuals having prolonged contact with Paradox 17 continued to display anomalous behavior afterward. Two expressed belief they were dreaming, four that they were in a hostile simulation. One of these latter individuals insisted on "finding the light again" during an interview before walking through their guards and the holding cell wall, and they haven't been seen since.

Can you ever really know that the Universe you perceive exists? That you'll never awaken one day to find it was all a dream? A planet full of philosophers sought the answers to these questions once upon a time… shortly before they all vanished en masse. They left behind confusing records stating that the light of a "whirling star" revealed that physical matter had no substance and the Universe was secretly a mental prison. These records are all that remain from the first known encounter with the being known as Paradox 17.

weapon->Flash Grenade (Advanced).name: Flash Grenade (Advanced)
weapon->Flash Grenade (Advanced).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round

A flash grenade unleashes a blast of bright light that requires creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:10] to attempt a @Check[fortitude|against:class] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 2 rounds.

weapon->Laser Pistol.name: Laser Pistol
weapon->Laser Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This compact pistol is the most popular sidearm in the Pact Worlds thanks to its reliability, durability, and affordability. Most common laser pistols have a lightweight polycarbon body ending in a long, slim barrel.

weapon->Polyglove.name: Polyglove
weapon->Polyglove.description:
Upgrades: 1

This glove features dozens of delicate tools for building or repairing computers and other technological items, requiring an entire hand (or suitable appendage) to manipulate. Overclocking the polyglove's components generates voltage between a wielder's fingertips.

armor->Flight Suit.name: Flight Suit
armor->Flight Suit.description:
Upgrades: 0

This comfortable coverall is made from lightweight thermal fabric and often adorned with patches displaying personal insignia, military rank, or even favorite bands or sports teams.

action->Elude Consequences.name: Elude Consequences
action->Elude Consequences.description:
Trigger The solipsist succeeds at a Will save, or an attack against them is a critical failure

Effect The solipsist teleports up to 25 feet in any direction of their choice. Creatures adjacent to the solipsist after they teleport are @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them until the end of the solipsist's next turn.

action->Perceive Unreality.name: Perceive Unreality
action->Perceive Unreality.description: The solipsist treats all creatures, objects, and structures they're observing (except for Paradox 17) as quasi-illusory, allowing the solipsist to move through them as though the solipsist were incorporeal. They can also choose to use Will for any saving throw against any non-damaging effect.

action->Area Fire (Flash Grenade).name: Area Fire (Flash Grenade)
action->Area Fire (Flash Grenade).description:
Flash Grenade (@Template[type:burst|distance:10], range 70 feet, tracking +1)

Effect @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 2 rounds on failure (@Check[fortitude|dc:26] save)

action->Baffling Attack.name: Baffling Attack
action->Baffling Attack.description: The solipsist deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures, and on the first successful melee Strike they make against an off-guard creature each turn, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} while stunned.

Plasma Ooze.name: Plasma Ooze
Plasma Ooze.publicNotes:
Plasma oozes pose a significant menace to seasoned spacefarers within the Pact Worlds. These entities materialize as expansive networks of crackling electromagnetic energy, assuming a captivating spherical form pulsating with luminous hues of purple and blue, with searing white-hot bursts scattered throughout.

These oozes primarily lurk near the surface of stars but are also drawn to potent electromagnetic phenomena elsewhere in the Universe. The electromagnetic fields exuded by the ooze present dangers in space, potentially even incapacitating shielded starships. Armed scions connected to the Plane of Fire, known as the Sunkillers, claim to actively hunt these enigmatic beings, armed with specialized gear and sonic weaponry.

Oozes of many types lurk in dark and abandoned places across the galaxy, emerging only to satiate their appetites and threaten adventurers, explorers, and hapless workers alike.

action->Thoughtsense.name: Thoughtsense
action->Thoughtsense.description: The plasma ooze can sense all non-mindless creatures within the listed range.

action->Electromagnetic Field.name: Electromagnetic Field
action->Electromagnetic Field.description:
100 feet. When an item with the tech trait is activated inside the aura, it must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2} on a critical failure).

A tech creature that starts its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2} on a critical failure).

An item or creature that succeeds at this save becomes immune to this aura for 1 hour.

action->Magnetic Draw.name: Magnetic Draw
action->Magnetic Draw.description: Large and smaller creatures and all unattended objects within 100 feet must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:36] save or be pulled 15 feet toward the plasma ooze (30 feet on a critical failure).

action->Plasma Drain.name: Plasma Drain
action->Plasma Drain.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect each creature and wielded object with the tech trait within 100 feet of the plasma ooze must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save. For each target that fails this save, the ooze regains @Damage[15[healing]] Hit Points and the object loses half of its remaining charges (if battery-powered).

action->Plasma Slag.name: Plasma Slag
action->Plasma Slag.description: A creature damaged by the ooze's pseudopod must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure). A creature with the tech trait uses the outcome one degree of success worse than the result of its roll.

Plasmazer.name: Plasmazer
Plasmazer.publicNotes:
Plasmazers are air elementals of vivid colors and grumpy disposition who became commonly found in the Universe after the invention of neon lighting. They manifest as dangerous explosions of light and color that shut down city grids, redirecting the power into a strobing neon kaleidoscope. They often take the shape of legendary birds or other creatures from local myths. Experimental club owners have tried harnessing plasmazers to produce special effects for their dance parties, but such situations usually end with dancers dodging plasma beams. The plasma slide is the name of a line dance that went viral after a plasmazer broke free at the Neon Crypt, an all-hours club on Eox with a reputation for rowdy fetes.

Elementals are energetic intrusions from the primal planes of existence. They take many forms, from mindless eddies in the wind or water to complex entities capable of wielding primal magic. The advent of space travel and the progress of technology have allowed even more living embodiments of the elements to manifest in the Universe.

Natural events like wildfires, solar storms, and floods can unleash hordes of unruly elementals on a planet or into a region of space. Sometimes, a gathering of powerful elementals causes a natural disaster on an epic scale, like an off-the-charts solar flare that fries a planet's power grid or a ceaseless storm swirling in a gas giant's atmosphere.

action->Redirect Arc.name: Redirect Arc
action->Redirect Arc.description:
Trigger The plasmazer takes electricity damage

Effect The plasmazer redirects the triggering effect to a creature within 30 feet. The creature attempts a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save. On failure, the creature takes an equal amount of electricity damage as the triggering effect.

action->Tinted Glow.name: Tinted Glow
action->Tinted Glow.description: A plasmazer emits bright light of their color in a 30-foot radius and dim light in the next 30 feet.

action->Flash Strike.name: Flash Strike
action->Flash Strike.description: The plasmazer Flies twice in a straight line, ignoring any creatures in their path as if the plasmazer is incorporeal. All creatures in or adjacent to the plasmazer's path take @Damage[4d6[electricity]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save. On critical failure, a creature also takes @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Presulea Midwife.name: Presulea Midwife
Presulea Midwife.publicNotes:
Presulea's mortal existence ended in self-sacrifice to feed the Newborn. Presulea was remade as a quivering mound of rampant growths and pumping organs that shimmer with vital energy.

Thirteen mortal Midwives attended the Newborn's birth and were transformed into eldritch beings by the nascent outer god's awakening. A Midwife always regenerates an identical new form so long as even a single speck of aucturnite—the name for the frozen chunks of planetcenta that once surrounded the Newborn—exists on this plane.

There are 13 types of Midwives, but their true numbers are unknown. Whether their names come from the mortal servants whose souls were the kindling for the Midwives' creation or have some other significance to the Newborn, also remains a mystery.

Each Midwife identifies themself by how they cared for the Newborn: if they swaddled, fed, carried, held, watched, warded, blessed, or performed other acts of nurturing for the outer god. The Midwives are powerful beings capable of transdimensional travel. They might be encountered in liminal spaces, such as the Drift or the Ghost Levels of Absalom Station, or they might be found among the clouds of aucturnite debris in the Gelid Edge. Their incomprehensible actions always advance the Newborn's inscrutable agenda—or their own.

The most well-known encounter the Pact Worlds have had with the Midwives took place in the immediate aftermath of the Newborn's birth. Amnieka, who swaddled the Newborn and has a hood of writhing tentacles around their visage, attacked Absalom Station directly, causing a massive power surge that threatened the lives of everyone on board. Chaos ensued, but a group of adventurers—who happened to be in the right elevator at the right time—found themselves in the station's Ghost Levels, where they thwarted Amnieka and prevented the Midwife from draining the station's reactors. The Midwives haven't acted so directly since that incident, but many suspect it's only a matter of time, and no one knows just how powerful the others might be.

action->Nourishing Aura.name: Nourishing Aura
action->Nourishing Aura.description: 100 feet. Presulea can sense the presence of any living creature inside their nourishing aura. This functions as an imprecise sense. Any spells with the healing or vitality trait are automatically heightened one rank (up to rank 4) if the caster is within the aura. Presulea treats a creature that casts such a spell as though they can always see it for 1 hour following the casting, ignoring the effects of any cover, concealment, invisibility, or similar effects.

action->Vital Siphon.name: Vital Siphon
action->Vital Siphon.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature within their nourishing aura uses an effect with the healing trait

Effect Presulea siphons half the amount that would be healed (rounded down) to heal themself or an ally within their aura instead of the original target.

action->Return to Aucturn.name: Return to Aucturn
action->Return to Aucturn.description: Presulea teleports to the location of any aucturnite fragment within a planetary range. Presulea automatically uses this ability as a free action when reduced to 0 Hit Points as long as a piece of aucturnite is within range, reforming their body and recovering completely over the next 24 hours.

Proog.name: Proog
Proog.publicNotes:
Proogs, unique among oozes, are cherished pets in many Pact Worlds households. These gentle, affable creatures are considered harmless in all but the worst of circumstances. Proogs quickly adapt to domestic life, are easily trained, and seem to delight in pleasing their owners with favored or humorous transformations. Late in their life cycle, these creatures reproduce by splitting in half without warning. Owners have noted that each resultant proog must relearn any tricks the original knew, leading researchers to conclude that the original proog is lost in the reproductive process.

Oozes of many types lurk in dark and abandoned places across the galaxy, emerging only to satiate their appetites and threaten adventurers, explorers, and hapless workers alike.

action->Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object
action->Mimic Object.description: A proog can spend 1 minute altering its appearance to imitate any solid object of 1 Bulk or less, though it can't duplicate moving parts or specialized functions. A mimicking proog gains a +2 Circumstance bonus to Deception checks to conceal its true nature. Touching the proog negates this bonus.

action->Pocket Protection.name: Pocket Protection
action->Pocket Protection.description: A proog can climb onto a Medium or larger creature occupying its space and attempt a Stealth check to [[/act hide]], even if observed.

Proog Swarm.name: Proog Swarm
Proog Swarm.publicNotes:
While individually cute and relatively harmless, when proogs gather in greater numbers, they become quite dangerous.

Oozes of many types lurk in dark and abandoned places across the galaxy, emerging only to satiate their appetites and threaten adventurers, explorers, and hapless workers alike.

action->Bouncing Blobs.name: Bouncing Blobs
action->Bouncing Blobs.description: The proog swarm bounces and squishes against all creatures in its space. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for as long as it remains in the swarm's space.

action->Leave Behind.name: Leave Behind
action->Leave Behind.description: The proog swarm Strides twice, dropping [[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.alien-core-bestiary.Actor.4Ne5pnML3LV9xYYU]{proogs} in the original space it occupied before taking this action.

action->Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object
action->Mimic Object.description: A proog can spend 1 minute altering its appearance to imitate any solid object of 1 Bulk or less, though it can't duplicate moving parts or specialized functions. A mimicking proog gains a +2 Circumstance bonus to Deception checks to conceal its true nature. Touching the proog negates this bonus.

action->Schlorp.name: Schlorp
action->Schlorp.description: Each enemy in the proog swarm's space takes @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic] save).

Protection-Class Security Robot.name: Protection-Class Security Robot
Protection-Class Security Robot.publicNotes:
