action->Shades Linger.description: The void ooze unleashes a pulse of magical darkness in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Nonmagical light is automatically extinguished for 1 minute. The ooze also attempts to counteract any 3rd-rank or lower magical light effect in this area (counteract rank 3, counteract modifier [[/r 1d20+17 #Counteract]]{+17}).

Void Palm.name: Void Palm
Void Palm.publicNotes:
A void palm poses a danger to sentient creatures and their antigravity technology alike. The plant propagates slowly yet steadily by catapulting an annual yield of brilliant blue seeds spaceward. The imparted momentum provides sufficient velocity for most seeds, aided by their supernatural ability to ignore gravity, to escape into the depths of space. Each seed drifts unremittingly until it encounters an object suitable for sustaining it, whether a wandering asteroid, planetary body, or sizable starship.

Once embedded in a fitting surface, a void palm seed germinates rapidly. Upon sprouting, the plant begins drawing nutrients from its surroundings, which periodically become enriched by the decomposing corpses or the oxidizing scraps of the plant's victims. The plant's fronds routinely sweep its area clear of remains or other debris that could serve as handholds or counterbalance or that could alert potential prey to their peril.

action->Antigrav Interference.name: Antigrav Interference
action->Antigrav Interference.description: 120 feet. The void palm causes antigravitational technology to malfunction. Upon entering this aura, any items or objects with the tech trait that employ some form of antigrav tech, including antigrav harnesses as well as most hover vehicles and starships, become glitching 1.

action->Disorienting Patterns.name: Disorienting Patterns
action->Disorienting Patterns.description:
Trigger A creature with darkvision within 60 feet of the void palm begins its turn

Requirements The void palm is in darkness

Effect The patterns on a void palm's mottled red fronds resemble a distant star field when viewed in the darkness. The void palm sways its fronds in a disorienting manner. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes immune to Disorienting Patterns for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of the void palm's next turn.

Failure As success, and the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the void palm's melee Strikes while it's dazzled.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute

action->Double Lash.name: Double Lash
action->Double Lash.description: The void palm makes two sweeping frond Strikes against the same target, each using its current multiple attack penalty. If both attacks hit, combine their damage. This counts as two attacks when calculating the void palm's multiple attack penalty.

action->Gravity Void.name: Gravity Void
action->Gravity Void.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The void palm creates a zero-gravity area of darkness in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], negating the effects of gravity and non-magical light sources in the area. Magical light sources in the area work normally. The void palm is unaffected by this lack of gravity, but other creatures that enter or start their turn in the area become untethered unless they can move normally in zero-gravity environments; they're also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while untethered in the area. An untethered creature attempting to Push Off in the area must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or the action is disrupted. The Gravity Void lasts for 10 minutes.

Void Zombie.name: Void Zombie
Void Zombie.publicNotes:
When an akata bites a humanoid, it infests them with microscopic, parasitic larvae. Those who perish from this parasitization, a condition known as void death, rise again as void zombies. While they resemble a typical rotting corpse, an elongated bluish-gray feeding tendril extends from their shattered lower jaw. When the immature akata within the body senses potential prey, this tendril often undulates and writhes with nauseating eagerness.

Once the host body dies, the larvae feed on each other until the strongest makes its way to the victim's brain. After several hours of rapid gestation, it attaches to the brain and infuses it with a mote of necromantic energy. This process leaves the larva ravenous, driving it to consume the blood of living creatures. Void zombies tend to last several weeks as the larva grows, but eventually its host compels it to seek out a safe, secluded place where it can disgorge the larva for one last surge of growth before the host body goes inert. Several hours later, a fully formed akata emerges from the frothing puddle, typically consuming the corpse as its first meal.

In general, akatas leave void zombies alone, and the larval parasites attempt to spread out to avoid competing for food. In a confined and undisturbed space, void zombies stand completely still to conserve energy. The juvenile akatas within become dormant and feed on the host body's tissue until they either reach maturity or sense a viable food source. Given the void zombie's relatively short existence, those who stumble upon a previous attack might find the void zombies already devoured or discarded and an eerie colony of silent, glassy cocoons full of ravenous hibernating akatas instead.

Void zombies tend to ignore other undead, but they become inexplicably aggressive when confronted with other creatures that are infested by parasites or otherwise controlled or influenced by external forces. Many have tried experimenting with void zombie behavior by forcing them to confront, for example, a rendworm host or a creature under the thrall of a spellcaster. Most such experiments end inconclusively at best, and many have ended in disaster.

action->Salt Water Vulnerability.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
action->Salt Water Vulnerability.description: Salt water quickly attacks a larval akata's cells as a strong acid. If the void zombie is fully immersed in salt water, it takes @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage from the water immediately and at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains immersed. Its weakness to salt water applies to this damage. On any round in which the void zombie takes damage due to its salt water weakness, the larval akata withdraws to hide within the host's body and renders the void zombie @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

action->Feed on Blood.name: Feed on Blood
action->Feed on Blood.description:
Requirements The void zombie's previous action was a successful feeding tendril Strike against a living creature

Effect The void zombie drains blood from the required creature using its feeding tendril. The void zombie regains @Damage[4[healing]] Hit Points, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

Voidsage.name: Voidsage
Voidsage.publicNotes: Voidsages are alghollthus who survived the battles of youth with an intact nanite network. After consuming many of their peers' own nanites, a voidsage's network grows strong enough to control a remote war machine.

action->Nanite Projection.name: Nanite Projection
action->Nanite Projection.description: A voidsage can share the senses and read the surface thoughts of creatures affected by their quantum nanites. A voidsage can project its mind into just one creature at a time, and choose which affected creature is the focus of its nanite projection as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. The creature also takes a –1 circumstance penalty to Will saves against any of the voidsage's spells as long as it's the focus of the voidsage's nanite projection.

action->Nanite Network.name: Nanite Network
action->Nanite Network.description: 5 feet. A voidsage exudes a cloud of nanites. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura is exposed to quantum nanites.

action->Revert.name: Revert
action->Revert.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger The voidsage takes damage while projecting

Effect The voidsage stops projecting and gains 50 temporary Hit Points that last for 10 minutes.

action->Quantum Nanites.name: Quantum Nanites
action->Quantum Nanites.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Maximum Duration 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} (1 day)

Vorthuul.name: Vorthuul
Vorthuul.publicNotes: Vorthuuls are undead beings with two overlapping yet incongruous forms: a distorted spirit shrieking in unending torment and a pitch-black skeleton overflowing with serenity. One form might seem more real than the other, only for the opposite to be true the next moment.

action->Crushing Gravity.name: Crushing Gravity
action->Crushing Gravity.description: 5 feet. A vorthuul is surrounded by the crushing gravitational forces of a black hole. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic] save).

action->Event Horizon.name: Event Horizon
action->Event Horizon.description: A vorthuul naturally draws in light. The DC of the flat check to target a vorthuul @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or hidden due to dim light or darkness is reduced by 2. A vorthuul takes a –2 circumstance penalty to AC and saving throws against light effects and to AC against attacks from weapons in the laser group.

action->Quantum Duality.name: Quantum Duality
action->Quantum Duality.description:
Vorthuuls exist in two states: one in perfect tranquility, the other in perpetual agony. The vorthuul gains bonuses depending on the dominant state. They decide which is dominant as a free action when they roll initiative.

  • Absolute Tranquility The vorthuul gains a +1 status bonus to saves against emotion effects and resistance 10 to mental damage.

  • Everburning Agony The vorthuul gains a +1 status bonus to saves against vitality effects and resistance 10 to fire damage.

action->Gravity Maelstrom.name: Gravity Maelstrom
action->Gravity Maelstrom.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The vorthuul intensifies their gravitational pull for 1 minute, increasing the radius of their crushing gravity aura to 20 feet. Additionally, while this aura is expanded, creatures moving in any direction other than directly toward the vorthuul treat squares in the aura as difficult terrain.

action->Quantum Agony.name: Quantum Agony
action->Quantum Agony.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The vorthuul is in absolute tranquility state

Effect The vorthuul enters everburning agony in torrents of anguish. Each creature in the vorthuul's crushing gravity aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Quantum Tranquility.name: Quantum Tranquility
action->Quantum Tranquility.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The vorthuul is in everburning agony state

Effect The vorthuul enters absolute tranquility in a wave of oppressive stillness. Each creature in the vorthuul's crushing gravity aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] save or be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or slowed 1 for 3 rounds on a critical failure).

action->Singularity Pocket.name: Singularity Pocket
action->Singularity Pocket.description: The vorthuul forces their physical and psychological torment upon a creature they touch. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:28] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 minute ([[/act escape dc=28]]). As long as it's immobilized in this way, it takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of each of its turns. Creatures that Escape become temporarily immune to this vorthuul's Singularity Pocket for 24 hours.

Vracinea.name: Vracinea
Vracinea.publicNotes: The vracinea is a large, shambling, multi-mawed plant, originally native to Castrovel but now found on many more planets. Slow and clumsy, it prefers to lure animals and other protein-rich prey with its blossoms. It then seeks to make a quick kill while the prey is befuddled by its spores. Though the paralytic effect of a vracinea's spores isn't potent at great distances, when these spores catch the wind, they help the plant spread to new habitats. A vracinea is a particularly cunning and territorial hunter that knows how to use local hazards. It's skilled at hiding its body in the underbrush, extending just its blossoms to lure in prey.

action->Invasive Spores.name: Invasive Spores
action->Invasive Spores.description:
10 feet. A vracinea constantly exudes sweet-smelling spores. Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to the vracinea's aura for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As success, plus the creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

action->Blossom Lure.name: Blossom Lure
action->Blossom Lure.description:
The vracinea's violet blossoms emit a magical glow that compels all onlookers to approach. Each non-vracinea creature within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save to avoid the lure. The effect lasts for 1 round, but the vracinea can Sustain this ability on subsequent rounds, extending the duration by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Blossom Lure, that creature is temporarily immune to Blossom Lure for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature must spend each of its actions to move closer to the vracinea as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a lured creature is adjacent to the vracinea, it stays still and doesn't act. If a lured creature takes damage from any source or is targeted by an enemy with an attack or hostile effect, the creature is freed from this effect at the end of the current turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but if damaged, attacked, or targeted, the creature attempts a new save at the start of its next turn, rather than being automatically freed at the end of the current turn.

action->Feeding Frenzy.name: Feeding Frenzy
action->Feeding Frenzy.description: The vracinea makes up to three jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count against the vracinea's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the vracinea makes all its attacks.

Wahtunshna.name: Wahtunshna
Wahtunshna.publicNotes:
Wahtunshnas are brokers, business negotiators, and war profiteers. They operate in the cities of Malfane and the watery planet Embroi and, increasingly, attend meetings with corporate legal teams in Near Space. Trained in negotiation, business administration, and the corporate buzzwords of a hundred cultures, wahtunshnas offer a competitive advantage to corporations while building a reputation of their own. The knowledge and industrial power of Hell are tempting to many companies looking to get an edge over their competitors, and wahtunshnas are more than happy to assist. In exchange for the incorporation of spyware into their products and Diabolic clauses in their terms of service, corporations gain access to the intellectual property of Hell, passing on infernal bloatware to their customers. Rumors claim that wahtunshnas contribute to the constant churn of start-ups whenever possible, sabotaging any companies that seek to break or circumvent the terms of their diabolical agreements.

In the shadows of space stations, halls of courtrooms, and offices of corporations, devils tempt mortals with promises of power and lay the groundwork for their conquest. A devil's pacts can vary from elaborate contracts to quick promises, but they all end the same way: a mortal soul condemned, and Hell's forces bolstered. From the open rule of Malfane, the unseen control of Embroi, and hidden pacts with souls across the galaxy, devils continue their relentless work to spread tyranny and force the universe to resemble the hellish bureaucracy of their home.

action->Infernal Tracking.name: Infernal Tracking
action->Infernal Tracking.description: For as long as a creature is taking persistent bleed damage from the wahtunshna's claw Strike, that creature can't be @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} from, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the wahtunshna.

action->Planned Obsolescence.name: Planned Obsolescence
action->Planned Obsolescence.description: The devil points at an item with the tech trait that they can see within 60 feet, forcing a firmware update so it becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 3}. A creature about to use the item can spend an Interact action to read through the item's new terms of service to remove this condition.

Warp Troll.name: Warp Troll
Warp Troll.publicNotes:
Warp trolls appear in areas where powerful magic or cosmic phenomena tear the fabric of space and time. Perhaps originating from another reality entirely, they find themselves trapped in a universe that's at once confusing to them but filled with delicious prey.

Warp trolls typically stand approximately 15 feet tall and weigh about 1,500 pounds. Their skin is pale green and partially translucent, showing glowing purple veins and the shadows of misshapen organs inside. Each limb has up to a dozen sharp, glass-like spikes that the trolls can detach and throw. A spike removed in this way regrows within the hour.

Warp trolls seem to have an instinctual understanding of Jotun and can learn other languages, but they rarely speak. Noise in general seems to alarm and disturb them, and in combat, they often target the creature making the most noise unless a greater threat presents itself. Unusually for trolls, these creatures possess telepathy with a limited range as well as somewhat complex minds. Getting close enough to communicate telepathically with a warp troll usually means standing within claw's reach, however, and few individuals take such a risk.

In pre-Gap times, trolls were renowned as vicious killers with the ability to regenerate their flesh, rebounding from nearly any injury and reacting with devastating violence. In the intervening centuries, even more horrifying troll specimens have emerged from the depths of space.

action->Defensive Phase.name: Defensive Phase
action->Defensive Phase.description:
Trigger An enemy scores a critical hit against the warp troll, or the warp troll critically fails a saving throw against a damaging spell

Requirements The warp troll's regeneration hasn't been deactivated

Effect The warp troll's body phases partially out of reality. They become incorporeal until the end of their next turn, gaining resistance 5 to all damage except force and Strikes with the ghost killer weapon property. This resistance is doubled against non-magical damage. The triggering damage is calculated using this resistance.

action->Fold Reality.name: Fold Reality
action->Fold Reality.description: The warp troll disappears into a pocket dimension until the start of their next turn. They can reappear in any unoccupied space within 60 feet of their previous location. The warp troll can't Fold Reality again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fold Reality]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Spike Shift.name: Spike Shift
action->Spike Shift.description: A warp troll's phasic spikes shift out of reality until they reach their target, ignoring circumstance bonuses to the target's AC granted by cover.

Warpstitcher.name: Warpstitcher
Warpstitcher.publicNotes:
Warpstitchers are self-proclaimed guardians of existence, holding the belief that they were created by the gods to sew together the space between alternate realities. These horrifying aberrations relentlessly hunt anything they suspect abuses magic or technology to change the fabric of the multiverse. Once they find their quarry, they wait only long enough to confirm their suspicions before attacking. Potential threats—a neophyte spellcaster trying their first cantrips, an academic theorist exploring interstellar travel—instead earn a telepathic warning of what awaits should they pursue their efforts too far. Everything other than threats (potential or otherwise) is a possible tool, a target for warpstitcher lies and coercion.

Their mere appearance is fuel for nightmares, with insectile limbs supporting a massive, bulbous torso. From their back spring five multi-segmented limbs ending in wicked claws threaded with the very stuff of reality that they use to skewer their prey, who they then sew into their bodies. Such unfortunate creatures quickly dissolve, possibly sustaining the warpstitchers, though whether that's through their flesh, thoughts, or alternate reality potential is unknown. Those few who survive are plagued by disturbing, haunting visions; a smaller percentage instead see visions of happier possible lives, gaining peace and sometimes unprecedented witchwarper powers.

action->Resist Reality.name: Resist Reality
action->Resist Reality.description:
Trigger The warpstitcher would take damage

Effect The warpstitcher gains resistance 12 to the triggering damage type until the start of their next turn. The resistance applies to the triggering damage.

action->Fold Reality.name: Fold Reality
action->Fold Reality.description: The warpstitcher collapses the space between themself and another location. They choose a 10-foot square within 120 feet. The warpstitcher then Strides, treating the chosen area as adjacent to them.

action->Threads of Quintessence.name: Threads of Quintessence
action->Threads of Quintessence.description: The warpstitcher's claws are laced with strands of quintessence they force into victims' wounds. This functions as Grab, or Improved Grab on a critical hit.

action->Warp Suture.name: Warp Suture
action->Warp Suture.description:
Requirements The warpstitcher has a creature @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The warpstitcher sews the creature into themself. The creature is pulled into the warpstitcher's space and moves with the warpstitcher. It becomes restrained and takes @Damage[3d12[force]] damage at the end of each of its turns until freed. Additionally, it takes @Damage[1d12[force]] damage whenever the warpstitcher uses Resist Reality (@Check[will|dc:34|basic] save). The Escape DC is 34 ([[/act escape dc=34]]), or the sutures can be severed (AC 25, Hardness 8, HP 30, weakness to slashing 5), freeing the creature. The warpstitcher can have up to 12 Bulk of creatures sewn into their body. The body of a creature that dies while sutured is absorbed into the warpstitcher's body and destroyed [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} later.

Wastewither.name: Wastewither
Wastewither.publicNotes:
When left untreated for too long, standing industrial wastewater attracts wastewithers from the elemental Plane of Water as it evaporates. Wastewithers contaminate everything they touch, turning solid ground and clean water into sludge. Many corporate dumping sites and toxic spills attract or spawn wastewithers, whose mere presence further contaminates the ecosystem.

Elementals are energetic intrusions from the primal planes of existence. They take many forms, from mindless eddies in the wind or water to complex entities capable of wielding primal magic. The advent of space travel and the progress of technology have allowed even more living embodiments of the elements to manifest in the Universe.

Natural events like wildfires, solar storms, and floods can unleash hordes of unruly elementals on a planet or into a region of space. Sometimes, a gathering of powerful elementals causes a natural disaster on an epic scale, like an off-the-charts solar flare that fries a planet's power grid or a ceaseless storm swirling in a gas giant's atmosphere.

action->Toxic Exhaust.name: Toxic Exhaust
action->Toxic Exhaust.description: 15 feet. A poisonous mist lingers around the wastewither. When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. If the creature fails, it's @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until it leaves the aura. Environmental protections or an appropriate spell provides a +2 circumstance bonus to saves against the aura.

action->Acid Rain.name: Acid Rain
action->Acid Rain.description: The wastewither vaporizes into a cloud and rains down acid drops. The wastewither Flies up to twice their Speed. Any creature the wastewither passes over takes @Damage[9d8[acid]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:23|basic] save. A wastewither can't use Acid Rain again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Acid Rain]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Contaminated Sludge.name: Contaminated Sludge
action->Contaminated Sludge.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect All terrain in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. All creatures that enter or begin their turn in the affected area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. This drained value is cumulative, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

Wayward Warp.name: Wayward Warp
Wayward Warp.publicNotes: A wayward warp is a living dimensional rift that causes unexpected havoc as they twist the world around them. No two wayward warps look the same, and no wayward warp keeps the same appearance for very long; every time a wayward warp moves, a different potential reality reveals itself. The warp themself is a rift at the center of the aura that appears like a tear in reality, often taking a shape vaguely resembling a feather star whose tentacles are lined with shard-like cracks in space itself.

action->Warp Sense.name: Warp Sense
action->Warp Sense.description: A wayward warp can sense creatures within their warp field as a precise sense at the listed range.

action->Reality Shimmer.name: Reality Shimmer
action->Reality Shimmer.description: The wayward warp has concealment against attacks originating outside of their warp field.

action->Warp Field.name: Warp Field
action->Warp Field.description:
15 feet. Reality within the area becomes a different type of terrain. Structures and creatures in the area aren't transformed, and the change immediately ends when the aura moves or the wayward warp dies. The nature of the aura is chosen randomly using the table below each time the wayward warp moves. A wayward warp is immune to their own warp field's effects and to the aligned damage type, but they gain weakness 5 to the opposing damage type.

[[/r 1d6]]{D6}FIELDALIGNED DAMAGEOPPOSING DAMAGEFIELD EFFECT
1CosmicVoidVitalityZero gravity
2EarthPiercingAcidDifficult terrain (sand)
3InfernoFireColdHazardous terrain (@Damage[1d6[fire]])
4StormElectricityBludgeoningHazardous terrain (@Damage[1d6[electricity]])
5FrozenColdFireUneven ground (ice)
6WaterBludgeoningElectricityUnderwater (flooded)

action->Spatial Rending.name: Spatial Rending
action->Spatial Rending.description: A creature hit by a wayward warp's spatial tendril must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:26] save or become misaligned to reality for 1 minute, gaining a condition based on the field effect while it remains in the warp field: @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.z1ucw4CLwLqHoAp3]{Untethered} (cosmic), @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} (earth or water), @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (inferno or frozen), or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 1} (any tech creature or held tech item in storm).

Whiptail Renkroda.name: Whiptail Renkroda
Whiptail Renkroda.publicNotes:
Whiptail renkrodas live along mountain slopes and rocky foothills, nesting in dark caves and rocky crags. They soar through the skies on powerful wings and attack with their long, lashing tails, which can coil around their prey like a whip. Many an unlucky traveler has been lashed by a whiptail renkroda's tail, hauled up into the air, and dropped to their death.

Renkrodas are a family of large dinosaur-like predators native to the planet Castrovel. They've spread beyond the jungle planet's boundaries thanks to smugglers, poachers, and ultra-wealthy big-game hunters. Bipedal and strong with long necks and decorative spines, renkrodas are best known for their terrifying roars, which they bellow frequently as a form of long-range communication and to scare away other predators and scavengers. Over a dozen species of renkrodas exist, each specially adapted to their environment or ecological niche.

action->Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
action->Twisting Tail.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the whiptail renkroda's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect The whiptail renkroda Strikes the target with its tail. If it hits, the whiptail renkroda disrupts the creature's action.

action->Aerial Predator.name: Aerial Predator
action->Aerial Predator.description: When a whiptail renkroda has a Medium or smaller creature @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, its Grab doesn't end if it moves away. Instead, when it moves, it carries the grabbed creature with it.

action->Fling.name: Fling
action->Fling.description:
Requirements A creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in the whiptail renkroda's tail

Effect The whiptail renkroda flings the creature through the air, launching the creature up to 10 feet up from its tail and 30 feet away. The creature takes falling damage accordingly. If the flung creature lands on another creature, the creature it lands on takes the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save).

action->Terrifying Roar.name: Terrifying Roar
action->Terrifying Roar.description:
The whiptail renkroda bellows ferociously. Each non-renkroda creature within 60 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Whiskered Renkroda.name: Whiskered Renkroda
Whiskered Renkroda.publicNotes:
The smallest of all renkrodas, whiskered renkrodas have adapted to move easily through dense jungles and forests and blend in amid the vibrant green flora. Whiskered renkrodas have whisker-like antennae growing from their chins that detect vibrations, enabling them to detect prey hiding amid the dense foliage. When they spot their prey, renkrodas charge into the fray and slam into their prey with enough force to topple trees or vehicles. Occasionally, whiskered renkrodas live and hunt in packs, to better protect themselves from larger predators.

Renkrodas are a family of large dinosaur-like predators native to the planet Castrovel. They've spread beyond the jungle planet's boundaries thanks to smugglers, poachers, and ultra-wealthy big-game hunters. Bipedal and strong with long necks and decorative spines, renkrodas are best known for their terrifying roars, which they bellow frequently as a form of long-range communication and to scare away other predators and scavengers. Over a dozen species of renkrodas exist, each specially adapted to their environment or ecological niche.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A whiskered renkroda can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement as an imprecise sense at the listed range.

action->Circling Reposition.name: Circling Reposition
action->Circling Reposition.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement within the whiskered renkroda's reach

Effect The whiskered renkroda circles its prey, Striding up to its Speed. The renkroda must move to a location where the triggering creature is within its reach.

action->Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
action->Forest Passage.description: The whiskered renkroda ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

action->Terrifying Roar.name: Terrifying Roar
action->Terrifying Roar.description:
The whiskered renkroda bellows ferociously. Each non-renkroda creature within 60 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

action->Upending Charge.name: Upending Charge
action->Upending Charge.description: The whiskered renkroda charges forward and slams into its prey. It Strides twice. If the whiskered renkroda ends its movement with an enemy within its reach, it makes a body Strike against that enemy. On a hit, the enemy is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Writhing Tentacles.name: Writhing Tentacles
Writhing Tentacles.descriptionHazard:
The kyokor's tentacles snake out, causing devastation.

When a kyokor passes by or through a settlement—or even attacks!—it leaves a trail of destruction that can be represented by the following hazards.

Terrifying, skyscraper-sized beasts roam the wastelands of Daimalko. Called colossi by the population, these monsters erupted from deep within the earth to stomp cities into dust, decimating the population and destroying every surface civilization on the planet in a terrifying Awakening. Kyokors are among the most dreaded colossi. There's no hope of defeating one without a valko—a war machine created by Daimalko's stubborn survivors to fight the colossi.
Writhing Tentacles.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:45] (legendary), @Check[occultism|dc:45] (legendary), or @Check[performance|dc:45] (legendary) to soothe or divert the kyokor's attention; using a guardian orb (see the sidebar on this page) to command the kyokor ends the hazard
Writhing Tentacles.reset: The kyokor's tentacles can't writhe again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge writhe]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Tentacle Slam.name: Tentacle Slam
action->Tentacle Slam.description:
Trigger A creature takes a hostile action against the kyokor, produces a visible area effect, or flies within 120 feet of the kyokor

Effect The kyokor deals @Damage[(6d10+28)[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:line|distance:120], and each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:40] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is pushed 20 feet away. If flying, it descends 20 feet.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is pushed 40 feet, and descends 60 feet (if flying) or is knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is pushed 60 feet away, descends 120 feet (if flying) or is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Wyspiria.name: Wyspiria
Wyspiria.publicNotes:
Whether they were created by the god Triune, the arc spectra Facilian, or by the Drift itself, wyspirias are a new evolution of spectra first encountered within the last few decades. Metaphysicians often explain wyspirias in contrast against iridias as spectra emissaries; where iridias travel the galaxy to share gifts of technology and information, wyspirias instead come to mortal worlds on a mission to collect and preserve mortal art and knowledge, storing it within themselves or bringing it back to the Drift for reasons as of yet unknown.

Wyspirias' glass-like bodies include a cascade of tentacle-like cords descending from their waists, which they use to plug themselves directly into both people and machines. Because their tentacles can resemble the outstretched roots of a small, floating tree, the librarian spectra are sometimes known as "trees of knowledge." They use their networks to transfer data and share emotional or sensory experiences between participants.

Though accounts of wyspirias appearing on mortal worlds are extremely rare, they've been known to sometimes involve themselves as mediators between warring civilizations. They work to ease tense negotiations at peace talks by connecting the opposing delegates to one another, enabling various parties to experience each other's perspectives. It's widely believed that spectra only dispatch wyspirias to intervene in mortal conflicts when a war could result in the loss of important information, prevent the discovery of future innovations, or interfere with the Drift itself.

In the Great Beyond, time is measured not in hundreds, thousands, or millions of years, but rather in eons—in iterations of reality itself. Only rising to prominence within the last three centuries alongside the advent and proliferation of Drift technology, spectra have thrived in a burgeoning niche of the otherwise stagnant zeitgeist of the Great Beyond.

Though their origins and objectives remain shrouded in mystery, encounters with spectra revolve around new technological discoveries, sharing the knowledge of faster-than-light travel, and protecting the Drift. No one knows if spectra existed before the Drift, but their connection to the hyperspace plane is indisputable. Prominent metaphysicians believe spectra were created as amalgams of raw quintessence pulled into the Drift, just as the Drift itself grows from pieces of the Multiverse. If this is true, spectra's interest in the proliferation of Drift technology takes a subtle sinister turn, as each new Drift engine serves to harvest the Great Beyond and all its denizens for the growth of the Drift and spectra themselves.
Wyspiria.languagesDetails: Arc network, Digital telepathy, Truespeech, Can't speak any language

action->Arc Network.name: Arc Network
action->Arc Network.description: The wyspiria can communicate through items and creatures with the tech trait, projecting sound from and speaking through the item or creature's voice, speakers, or other audio output. In addition, the excuba can use any item or creature with the tech trait within their digital telepathy aura as the point of origin for their spells and abilities when calculating range, distance, line of effect, and area of effect.

action->Slip Drive.name: Slip Drive
action->Slip Drive.description: An wyspiria has an internal biomechanical Drift engine, allowing them to function as a Drift engine for a starship or vehicle they pilot as a 1-minute activity. An excuba can enter or exit the Drift themself as a 1-minute activity. When an excuba gets a critical failure on a Piloting check to Navigate or Plot a Course through the Drift, they get a failure instead.

action->Techsense.name: Techsense
action->Techsense.description: The wyspiria senses creatures and objects with the tech trait as a precise sense within the listed range.

action->Digital Telepathy.name: Digital Telepathy
action->Digital Telepathy.description: 100 feet. A wyspiria can communicate telepathically with any item or creature with the tech trait within their aura as well as with other technologically telepathic creatures (such as those with shortwave and similar abilities). This ability also allows the spectra to remotely attempt Computers checks within their aura.

action->Borrow Time.name: Borrow Time
action->Borrow Time.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger The wyspiria's turn begins

Effect The wyspiria pulls potential energy from their future self to use in the present. The wyspiria becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} this turn and can use the extra action only for Fly, Stride, and Strike actions. At the end of the wyspiria's turn, they become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of their next turn.

action->Connect.name: Connect
action->Connect.description: When a wyspiria Grabs a creature with a tentacle Strike, they automatically plug one of their many cord-like appendages into it. The sudden connection feeds the creature a stream of information and fabricated sensory data, making them @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save. If the wyspiria moves, they bring the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} creature along with them. The wyspiria doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the creature grabbed; the creature remains grabbed as long as it's connected. The grabbed creature can attempt to [[/act escape dc=30]] as normal. The wyspiria can connect with up to 10 creatures simultaneously.

action->Overload Connections.name: Overload Connections
action->Overload Connections.description:
Requirements At least one creature is connected to the wyspiria's tentacles

Effect The wyspiria maintains their connection. All connected creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

action->Piercing Signal.name: Piercing Signal
action->Piercing Signal.description: The wyspiria emits a series of synthesized squeals. Each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] takes @Damage[6d6[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage and @Damage[6d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:30|basic] save) and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute on a failure (or 10 minutes on a critical failure). While a creature is deafened in this way, it also can't understand telepathic communication or any message conveyed by a tech device—for example, the target perceives text on comm units or other digital displays as scrambled text. The wyspiria can't use Piercing Signal again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Piercing Signal]]{1d4 rounds}.

Xenowarden Biohulk.name: Xenowarden Biohulk
Xenowarden Biohulk.publicNotes:
Biohulks are devoted Xenowardens who purposefully fused their body with plants and other flora to gain formidable strength. This transformation is usually accomplished using biotech, magic, or genetic experimentation, and can't be reversed. Regardless of their method, biohulks are incredibly strong and capable of battering down most artificial barriers with ease. Xenowarden biohulks are usually extremists, entirely and passionately devoted to the Xenowardens' cause.

The Xenowardens are a powerful and well-respected organization who aim to safeguard and study the natural world and ensure that technological advances are ecologically responsible. With an incredibly diverse membership, their ranks include, among others, hermits who practice nature magic and eschew technology and scientists who create renewable energy from algae. On the other end of the spectrum are elite combat units like the Wildknights and the Greenguards and feared ecoterrorists like the enigmatic Oleander. The Xenowardens are led by a Greenspeaker, who's elected by acclaim and advised by their peers.

weapon->Artillery Laser.name: Artillery Laser
weapon->Artillery Laser.description:
Upgrades: 1

The fast-firing and continuous beams of this laser cannon converge on the target to create enough heat to melt a steel door into slag.

weapon->Hammer.name: Hammer
weapon->Hammer.description:
Upgrades: 1

Valued as both a crafting tool and an effective weapon, this hammer uses specially weighted heads and handles to deliver maximum force with each strike.

weapon->Grenade Launcher (Tactical).name: Grenade Launcher (Tactical)
weapon->Grenade Launcher (Tactical).description:
Upgrades 1

Activate 2 Area Fire

The rotating barrel of this automatic breechloading launcher holds up to six grenades of any variety with smart loading technology, allowing its wielder to choose a different grenade each time they fire. A grenade launcher is a martial ranged weapon, has a reload of 2, and a range 350 feet.

weapon->Frag Grenade (Advanced).name: Frag Grenade (Advanced)
weapon->Frag Grenade (Advanced).description:
Activate 1 Area Fire

Critical @Damage[1d6[bleed]]

These fragmentary grenades explode in a cloud of shrapnel and deal 3d8 piercing damage in a @Template[burst|distance:10] with a @Check[reflex|against:class|basic] save.

armor->Lattice Armor.name: Lattice Armor
armor->Lattice Armor.description: Also known as "varman" in some parts of the Impossible Lands, this armor is made from fine metal cables woven into latticework patterns with plated segments to protect the head, neck, and shoulders. This armor disperses blows much like rings of chain mail but is much tighter in construction, making it quieter.

action->Battering Charge.name: Battering Charge
action->Battering Charge.description: The Xenowarden biohulk Strides three times, then makes a melee Strike, dealing an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage on a hit. If the target of this Strike is an object or construct, this Strike ignores 5 Hardness.

action->Destructive Power.name: Destructive Power
action->Destructive Power.description: Whenever a Xenowarden biohulk makes a melee Strike that would deal bludgeoning damage, that Strike gains the razing trait.

action->Nature's Fury.name: Nature's Fury
action->Nature's Fury.description: The Xenowarden biohulk bellows with rage, causing plants to sprout from the ground and hinder the biohulk's enemies. Creatures within 30 feet of the biohulk take @Damage[6d8[slashing]] damage from the thrashing plants (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save), and the area becomes difficult terrain for 10 minutes. The Xenowarden biohulk ignores difficult terrain created by Nature's Fury. Then, the Xenowarden biohulk can attempt an Intimidation check to [[/act demoralize]] each creature in the area.

Xenowarden Greenhorn.name: Xenowarden Greenhorn
Xenowarden Greenhorn.publicNotes:
The Greenguards are an elite combat unit of Xenowardens known for their nature magic, often dispatched to sites of extreme ecological upheaval. New recruits to the Greenguards are given the rank of "root" but are colloquially called "greenhorns." Xenowarden greenhorns train extensively in tight-knit units.

The Xenowardens are a powerful and well-respected organization who aim to safeguard and study the natural world and ensure that technological advances are ecologically responsible. With an incredibly diverse membership, their ranks include, among others, hermits who practice nature magic and eschew technology and scientists who create renewable energy from algae. On the other end of the spectrum are elite combat units like the Wildknights and the Greenguards and feared ecoterrorists like the enigmatic Oleander. The Xenowardens are led by a Greenspeaker, who's elected by acclaim and advised by their peers.

weapon->Arc Pistol.name: Arc Pistol
weapon->Arc Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

Instead of traditional ammunition, this bulky pistol contains a capacitor that generates arcs of electricity. Its stock is crafted from polycarbon or other synthetic insulators, often tinted bright yellow and inscribed with the universal bolt symbol for high voltage.

weapon->Knife.name: Knife
weapon->Knife.description:
Upgrades: 1

Invaluable as both a weapon and a tool, knives come in a variety of shapes, styles, and materials ranging from starmetals to ceramics.

weapon->Nano-edge Rapier.name: Nano-edge Rapier
weapon->Nano-edge Rapier.description:
Upgrades: 1

The edge of this precision-crafted foil is sharpened to the thickness of a single atom, using regenerating nanites to maintain itself after countless strikes.

armor->Tempweave.name: Tempweave
armor->Tempweave.description:
Upgrades: 1

Tempweave suits are reinforced hooded garments woven with thermal fabric and venting wires, popularly worn for trips to humid climates like the jungles of Castrovel or Pulonis.

action->Grown Together.name: Grown Together
action->Grown Together.description: A Xenowarden greenhorn's AC increases by +1 when they're within reach of at least one other Xenowarden greenhorn.

Xenowarden Rootsworn.name: Xenowarden Rootsworn
Xenowarden Rootsworn.publicNotes:
Xenowarden rootsworn are mentors and teachers, tasked with overseeing the training and command of a platoon of roots. Most rootsworn are talented spellcasters who can manipulate plants, using them to shield the Xenowarden from harm and to deploy allies across the battlefield.

The Xenowardens are a powerful and well-respected organization who aim to safeguard and study the natural world and ensure that technological advances are ecologically responsible. With an incredibly diverse membership, their ranks include, among others, hermits who practice nature magic and eschew technology and scientists who create renewable energy from algae. On the other end of the spectrum are elite combat units like the Wildknights and the Greenguards and feared ecoterrorists like the enigmatic Oleander. The Xenowardens are led by a Greenspeaker, who's elected by acclaim and advised by their peers.

weapon->Laser Pistol.name: Laser Pistol
weapon->Laser Pistol.description:
Upgrades: 1

This compact pistol is the most popular sidearm in the Pact Worlds thanks to its reliability, durability, and affordability. Most common laser pistols have a lightweight polycarbon body ending in a long, slim barrel.

weapon->Baton.name: Baton
weapon->Baton.description:
Upgrades: 1

This reinforced rod is commonly made from metal alloys and designed to strike and parry incoming blows.

armor->Carbon Skin.name: Carbon Skin
armor->Carbon Skin.description:
Upgrades: 1

This form-fitting suit of carbon fiber encases the body. Most are usually dull-gray, functional garments, while pricier, bespoke suits dazzle like diamonds.

action->Root Deflection.name: Root Deflection
action->Root Deflection.description:
Trigger The rootsworn is standing on a solid surface and would be hit by a ranged Strike

Effect A mass of magical roots rapidly sprout from the ground and shield the Xenowarden rootsworn from harm. The Xenowarden rootsworn gains a +2 status bonus to their AC against the triggering Strike.

action->Root Network.name: Root Network
action->Root Network.description:
1 to 2

The Xenowarden rootsworn conjures magical roots to move their allies around the battlefield. They select one willing ally within 100 feet who's standing on a solid surface, or three willing allies if they spend 2 actions to perform Root Network. The roots move each target up to their Speed in a direction of their choice, then deposit them safely on a solid surface.

Yearling Arabuk.name: Yearling Arabuk
Yearling Arabuk.publicNotes:
Yearling arabuks collect in glarings. They're abandoned by their mothers days after birth, then adopted by a mature arabuk that raises them as a group.

Those traveling through Akiton's Winterlands risk stumbling on its apex predator: the carnivorous arabuk.

action->Snow Vision.name: Snow Vision
action->Snow Vision.description: Snow doesn't impair a yearling arabuk's vision; it ignores concealment from snowfall.

action->Glacial Stride.name: Glacial Stride
action->Glacial Stride.description: The arabuk Strides twice with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring difficult terrain caused by ice, snow, or other arctic conditions.

Zalyop.name: Zalyop
Zalyop.publicNotes:
The jet streams of the gas giant Bretheda are filled with large, bulbous silhouettes called zalyops, sometimes referred to as balloon plants. Gas-filled and hardy, they're buffeted around by the planet's eternal storms. It's common for a cascade of these plants to be found trailing in the wake of an oma or plastered against one of the many spacecrafts and aircrafts frequenting the gas giant.

The sound of zalyops bouncing against a metal hull at high velocity can be a humorous one, but travelers should be careful not to assume these plants are harmless. Zalyops are known to expel high-speed organic shrapnel by reflex. Additionally, their confusion-inducing gaseous waste easily spreads across the atmosphere and can be caught in a ship's air-intake valve.

Zalyops can also cause chaos at ground level. When they float into small settlements, flocks of them will descend on small creatures, which they engulf for nutrients. The widespread befuddling clouds caused by such incursions are a dangerous nuisance. Pedestrians and pets alike must take care during such events to stay inside and simply wait the invasive balloons out.

Pact Worlds chemists have developed (and patented) Balyoon, an anesthetic drug from zalyop gases. In addition to being difficult to obtain in the first place, the drug is highly unstable until refined in the laboratory, and more than one starship has been lost when its crew failed to properly store the gases they just harvested from a zalyop.

Balyoon also plays a role in Eoxian soap operas and other dramatic vidshows across the Pact Worlds. It's used as a plot device in a myriad of ways, such as a villain contriving to discredit a hero or for a family member to suddenly lose their mind or memory in a soap opera. How these characters obtained the processed gas of a predatory Brethedan plant is rarely as important as the exciting drama, however.

action->Explosive Burst.name: Explosive Burst
action->Explosive Burst.description:
Trigger The zalyop is reduced to 0 Hit Points by physical or fire damage

Effect The zalyop explodes, dealing @Damage[4d6[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] centered on itself (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save). This also triggers a Befuddling Cloud, even if it's been used in the last hour.

action->Befuddling Cloud.name: Befuddling Cloud
action->Befuddling Cloud.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The zalyop expels a gaseous cloud in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures within the cloud must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (or 1 minute on a critical failure). Confused creatures that are also engulfed by the zalyop don't receive flat checks to end the confused condition.

Zitteroc.name: Zitteroc
Zitteroc.publicNotes:
Zitterocs are vicious reptilians native to the Kazmurg's Absurdity world of Azhan Prime. Due to the native Azhans' propensity for trading, these creatures have made their way across the cosmos and found new homes in the galaxy's various wetlands. Zitterocs are renowned across the galaxy for their ability to innately detect and somehow ignore even the most virulent poisons. They can siphon such poisons from targets and convert them into a fuel source for their digestive acids. Even after this siphoning process, trace amounts of poison can be found within a zitteroc, and the fresh bodies of zitterocs are often a cornucopia of medicinal substances for biotechnicians and pharmaceutical experts.

At maturity, a zitteroc stands only 2 to 3 feet tall, with a length roughly double that size. They possess a sickly blue hide that shimmers like an oil slick and can take on the rough properties of its surroundings with concentration. Additionally, they can feign a sickening death when threatened by hunters or more dangerous predators. These typically docile carnivores can become vicious when they run out of abundant food from less threatening animals, at which point they make their way into the fringes of civilization.

action->Poison Sense.name: Poison Sense
action->Poison Sense.description: A zitteroc can detect poison as an imprecise sense at the listed range, including poisonous substances, poisoned creatures, and creatures with attacks that inflict poison.

action->Sickening Death.name: Sickening Death
action->Sickening Death.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The zitteroc takes damage

Effect The zitteroc releases a spray of acid in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15], dealing @Damage[4d4[acid]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save), then uses Still as a Corpse.

action->Shimmer Hide.name: Shimmer Hide
action->Shimmer Hide.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The zitteroc focuses on shifting its hide pattern to match its surroundings. The zitteroc becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to creatures more than 15 feet away from it until the start of its next turn.

action->Siphon Poison.name: Siphon Poison
action->Siphon Poison.description:
Requirements The zitteroc's last action was a successful mandibles Strike

Effect The zitteroc siphons poison from the struck target's bloodstream. If the target is afflicted by a poison or possesses a natural poison, the zitteroc consumes that poison to empower its own abilities. The poison effect is suppressed on the target for 1 round, or the target can't use its natural poison until the end of its next turn. Until the end of the zitteroc's next turn, the zitteroc increases its acid damage die size for its mandibles and acid spit Strikes, and Sickening Death, by one step (typically to d6s).

action->Still as a Corpse.name: Still as a Corpse
action->Still as a Corpse.description: Until the next time it acts, the zitteroc appears to be dead. It has an automatic result of 21 on @Check[deception] checks and DCs to pass as a dead zitteroc.
